scraped_reviews.content: So I've had this account for a few months. I found out that a transaction on my account was a fraud. Called them. After being transferred 5 times I was finally told that because it is pending there is nothing they can do. Really. Every other bank can stop payment. Can you block that merchant from taking more. Also a no! So I hang up. Go to another account and try to transfer myoney so it's safe, I tried 2 accounts GO2 stopped me from moving my own money. I rate them -1. Run Don't use

App has a bug in it. It will not let me upload images to deposit a check! Horrible app!! And horrible banking. It took 10 business days to get a $19 credit back in my account from Lyft that refunded me in minutes of not finding a ride for me. I had this account for YEARS and their banking structure has gotten worse and WORSE over time. Will NOT be using their services again. Also direct deposits are not early with this service although they still claim to be. Switched my direct deposit too.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Suzette, thank you for giving us such a high rating and for taking the time to provide us with your comments. When our cardholders tell us about their experiences, it means a lot to us. We're glad we were able to meet your expectations! -AT

scraped_reviews.content: UPDATE 07/07/23 - Always love my app and card had no problems in a year but the past few days I can't get the 'Cash A Check' to work... when I saw my review thought it weird I had this same problem almost exactly a year ago... 07/11/22 -Great app. Easy to check. Savings earn interest. Only downside was I couldn't get the add money by taking a picture of a check to work
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. Thanks for taking the time to leave a review. You may go to Play Store to check if you're using the latest version of the app. Also, please try to take the photo in good lighting. Focus on the image and hold your phone steady. If the issue persists, please login to go2bank.com and click the "Chat" icon to start a chat for further assistance.-AA

scraped_reviews.content: It is a great app for banking needs plus it gives you way more rewards for saving money. Well they have made me take back 3 stars cuz they have not released my money, I had a little problem with a merchant but, they came thru with flying colors on solving this issue, but when I got my new card my account was locked because of the issue and I was told to wait a few days after I received the letter and it would be open back up, it's been three months, and I still can't get my money ðŸ˜¡ðŸ¤¬ I'm pissed
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Kelvonne Thank you so much for taking the time to provide feedback. We are so delighted that you rate our service as 5-star. We take pride in knowing our customers are happy with their banking experience. - ET

scraped_reviews.content: It use to be awesome! Now you can't talk to customer support no matter how many times you call there's just not even a option with the Walmart card , so needless to say I can't add money at the check out isle at Walmart like your supposed to be able to enter the amount you want to add to your card before you get to the checkout and enter the cash in the register but this option is beyond anyone's comprehension at go2 . Id like to tell them where to go to because it keeps charging my card monthly
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello, we're sorry about this. You may reload your GO2bank by swiping your card at a retail store or generate a secure barcode in the app and scan the code at a retail store. Fees and limits apply. You may find the nearest retail location in your area using the app. For the monthly fee, you may refer to this link: https://tinyurl.com/bdcpzcu4. -ET

scraped_reviews.content: I absolutely love this bank and app is super user friendly!!! however I transferred money to my husband's bank account that I needed to be there immediately and it took it out but didn't transfer it. After calling customer support I learned they don't do transfers and my money will be returned in 24 hours!!! I recommend taking that option off your app if it doesn't work why is it there? FIX IT R GET RID OF IT!!! This caused me a HUGE amount of unnecessary stress!! Otherwise I LOVE IT!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, Shannon! Thank you so much for your review! As of the moment, we are still working on having Send Money and P2P added to the app. Once it is added, we'll be sending out a notification regarding it. To know more about GO2Bank features, please visit https://www.go2bank.com/help. Thank you! -ARP

scraped_reviews.content: I needed this Prepaid card to pay a bill. after spending 2 hours trying to get the card activated, I got frustrated and waited a couple weeks. then magically it worked. I then wanted to close my account. I used the chat to do so because I didn't see an option on the website. the representative then closed the account before telling me how I can get a refund for the remaining balance. I wanted a paper check but apparently now have to call them and spend MORE time calling them?! BUYER BEWARE
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we want to know more about your issue. We would appreciate it if you could send us the details by logging into your account at www.go2bank.com and clicking the "Chat" icon to initiate a chat for assistance, or by sending us a private message to one of our social media accounts. You may also call us at (855)-459-1334 for immediate assistance.

scraped_reviews.content: Honestly, for non traditional banking... they have been amazing as a secondary account. They have overdraft protection, a secured credit card that has helped improve my credit score, and a savings account. Let me say that customer service is superior to any major bank. Chat support is almost instant connection to an agent and phone support is pretty quick also. For anyone who wants a online bank, secondary account, or whatever the case may be. It's worth consideration GO2Bank.

title: Fitness & Bodybuilding
descriptionHTML:
Fitness & Bodybuilding is an innovative and powerful fitness app that provides pre-set workout plans for Bodybuilding, Strength-Training, Muscle Tone, General Conditioning, and Powerlifting.
We are here to guide you and help you to build your core strength, melt your unwanted weight and improve your performance.
A user-friendly interface allows everyone to take full advantage of exercises for training the most important muscle groups. Not only is it going to replace your traditional coach but it also will let you track your performances in a simple way in order to make precise analyses about your workout. And itâ€™s like having the best personal trainer in the palm of your hand, available 24/7/365.

Fitness & Bodybuilding is for those who want to start a new active lifestyle, build healthy habits, and feel amazing.
Weâ€™ll keep your gym or home sessions fresh and fun by mixing up your workouts with new exercises and maximizing the use of your available equipment. Between workouts, your training plan will maximize fitness gains by varying intensity (weight) and volume (sets/reps) between sessions. No muscle group is left behind in your training plans

Fitness & Bodybuilding is for those who want to start a new active lifestyle, build healthy habits, and feel amazing.

By choosing Fitness & Bodybuilding app for your workouts youâ€™ll get:
- Effective exercises for each muscle group;
- Detailed description of each exercise;
- High-quality photo and video guidance;
- Images of involved muscles;
- Pre-set workouts specific to your goals;
- Ability to add your own workout with your custom exercises and add photos;
- Built-in Journal for your workouts, for sets, reps, and weights;
- Built-in timer and calendar;
- History of all your data with interactive graphs of your performance;
- Fastest support;
- Frequent updates;
- Training plans created by top personal trainers
- No muscle group is left behind in your personalized training plan.

Subscription Info:
As a Fitness & Bodybuilding app user, you can choose the subscription plan that best suits your needs. Our Premium 1-year subscription plan offers unlimited access to every level of every imaginable workout routine in exchange for a single payment. In addition, a 1-week subscription and 1-month are available for users. For your convenience, subscriptions are set to automatically renew within the 24-hour period prior to the subscription end date. You can cancel your subscription at any moment in your iTunes account settings but refunds will not be provided for any unused portion of the terms. Payment will be charged to iTunes Account at confirmation of purchase. Any unused portion of a free trial period, if offered, will be forfeited when the user purchases a subscription to that publication, where applicable.

Please read our terms of service at https://vgfit.com/terms and our privacy policy at https://vgfit.com/privacy
Feel free to direct all your questions and suggestions to www.vgfit.com
summary: Exercises and Workouts

scraped_reviews.content: I was perfectly content with using this app for years, then yesterday, they put up a paywall. I could no longer access my routines or stats until I subscribed. They offer a "free four day trial", during which you can cancel to avoid the monthly charge, as long as it's a day before the trial ends (or something like that). Well, I signed up last night and cancelled about 12 hours later, only to be told by Google that my subscription will be closed after the point where I will incur a fee. I don't mind the ads, I've happily used this app for years, but there is nothing that warrants a $5/month subscription. Edit: it appears I did NOT get charged post cancellation, yet at least. It is still disappointing to see greed take over such a great app. Uninstalling after 2+ years of regular use.

This was a great app for tracking progress. I used it for a few year. I didn't use the routines, just the weights and rep tracking. Now I have to endure longer and longer ads each time I use the app unless I pay a monthly subscription. It started at 5 seconds of ads and loud music. Now it's up to 17 seconds each time I select a different workout. I will be choosing another app.

I really liked the options this app had for pre defined workouts. It also has a pretty good selection of specific exercises organized by muscle group. You can track your workout but there doesn't seem to be a way to define your own workout ahead of time. The videos demonstrating the exercises are nice to have for an amateur. The reason for only two stars is the ads, so many ads, and they are not just a bar on the screen. The worst ones are video ads you cannot dismiss for 10s and stop my music.

I was using the app on a trial basis and it worked fine. I downloaded for the year and immediately started to have issues. I'm not showing as subscribed and when I try to enter custom exercises, it says I need to add permissions. I have already given the app unrestricted access, but I'm still having problems. I emailed the developers. That was a research project since they don't have support built into the app, I had to find a forum that would help with email. One month later and nothing

Used to be good but they ruined it with the ad experience. I understand the ad at the beginning trying to get you to sign up but it happens LITERALLY EVERY TIME YOU CLICK INTO ANYTHING NEW. Oh, and the ads get longer each time and blare music over your own. It's also been glitchy and will just start blaring the ad music without showing the ad so you have to restart in order to get anywhere. After years of using this app, I will be leaving for something else. It's very frustrating and sad.

I liked using it just to see some workouts when I don't remember some movements for specific body parts. Only used it once or twice a week. But ever since they added ads to everything you click on.... I can't anymore. I'd like to go from movement to movement, and I try to measure my brakes. This just ads time to it. Not to mention, I usually have my headphones on and the music that blairs out over my own music is so damn loud. At least the music isn't bad though.

Love it so far!!! I'm using the customizable workouts. It's great that all moves are categorized by body part. I'm new to weight lifting and the diagrams and videos help me know that I'm doing all of the moves correctly. Also entering in my information when the workout is over is super easy. I just paid for the subscription so we'll see how the other parts work. I thought having the option to pay $4.99 a month was really useful. I personally don't like paying for a whole year upfront.

Great app even without subscription, but it's more or less a prebuilt, generic workout spreadsheet. The only improvement that I could see that would bring this to 5 stars is the ability/option to add notes to specific workouts that are tracked for that day. I often go to gyms at peak times and need to substitute a machine from free-weights, and it would be a good way to track why my tracking could seem off. Otherwise, great app, but there are similar/better options out there.

Up until about a month a go this app had 5 star review. And then something happened where everytime I try to add info for different workouts, it's extremely slow. It's not my phone but seems like it's just this app. Not sure what happened to make it slow. Please fix and ill change my review back to 5 stars. The ads are terrible. Started as 5 seconds, now up to 13 seconds.

Originally gave 5* but changing it to 2 because of the ads they added even if you're a paid subscriber. They interrupt your workout plus I believe there shouldn't be ads for paid subscribers. Great all around app if you're new to working out or the gym. It has many tools to guide you through a workout and keep track of the weights you're using.

I would give this app a solid 4-5 stars, however, after a recent update, I have been experiencing performance issues. I'm not sure how to reach out to the app developers, so I'm putting rhis review here. Whenever I open a workout that I have a lot of history with (such as bench press or deadlifts), the app freezes up and is difficult for me to enter my progress. For context, I have multiple years of progress recorded for these excercises

Edit: I paid for all the exercises and paid to fully unlock the app when I first got it a few years ago. Now all of a sudden there are adds everytime I switch to a new exercise, and now they want 7.99 a month or 50 ayear to stop the ads. Really nice app with a variety of different exercises for each muscle group which helps to change up routines. Another nice feature is it has a good mix of exercises that do and do not require weights to do.

I liked the app before the most recent update. There was a search function that was really great when creating your own workout plan (which is part of the free version). Everything else is great. The stock exercises are good, but adding custom exercises is amazing. The best part is the log of your workouts that shows when you pick into each exercise so you know exactly the weight you should aim for. Really great app if they bring back the search function.

Deleted the app, this is a good starter app, but there are better out there. You have Shoulder exercises in Back, and so on. You have exercises missing, it constantly loses data so your progress is lost. There are 3 or 4 exercises that are repeated in each category. there is no way to change the order of the exercises listed..... this app costs over $50 it should be better.

I've used the free version of this app for quite afew years now and in the past Ive recommended it friends. However, I would not recommend it anymore, the ads are too intrusive, loud and you cant skip them. I understand that the developers might want to make more money but there are currently better free fitness tracking apps out there. I'm considering leaving.

Thank you very much for this app. It is very useful for tracking my progress in weights that I lift. I can see my progress. I have several suggestions to make this app better: (1) Cloud backup. I am afraid of losing my 3 months worth of progress data. (2) Switching mass units (kg - lb) on the exercise interface. I don't want to exit the exercise interface everytime just to switch units. (3) Progress charts. It will be very helpful if there are visual representations of progress.

I have been using it for years. I like the simplicity without useless stuff added. I like the interface and that you can easily add your own exercise that are not in the database. I would love if they added a way to track volume (as a number next to the reps) for a given exercise so you can compare the volume your current workout to the one before.

Paid 11.99 back on May 21, 2018 for full access but now there are ads and a subscription? I understand companies must generate revenue but here's 2 stars for it. If you're okay with the side ads and an occasional video, I do recommend the app otherwise you'll have to search further to find one without in-app purchases or subscription fees. Best of luck.

Half of the excersizes are not accessible unless you're a paid user. Moreover, a 30 second ad/reminder to buy premium plays between every excersize you open. You can't stop it, you can't skip it, you can't back out either - so if you chose the wrong excersize you get to wait for 30 seconds to just back out and then another 30 seconds when you get to what you actually meant to get to. And if you're just browsing, looking for STH new or just checking your stats - 30 second wait EVERY TIME

It's unusable. I paid for the premium version a couple years ago, but now they want subscription fees anyway. If you don't pay, it's unusable because of the ads/music that play every time you click anything. Read the other recent reviews, not the older ones from when the app was good. I use to love this app, but clearly things have changed.

Used to be good, I used to pay for it. Returned to working out recently, installed it again and it's just horrible with the constant ads. Very shortsighted move by the devs - yes, you might force a few more users to subscribe but at the cost of massive decline in overall active users due to plummeting ratings. Increase in revenue for one quarter doesn't seem worth losing a chunk of active users for life.

Really good app for being free. You get a lot more if you pay. Mostly videos that you can probably find straight know youtube. The scheduling makes absolutely no sense and is kind of rough to figure out. Otherwise, the app is great and teaches you all kinds of different workouts. Videos, pictures, and a written step by step description on how to do the exercise. I also like that it has pictures that show which part of your body the workout will target. Recommend for beginners.

Ads Galore I've had this app for at least a year now and it didn't have so many ads in the beginning. Now when you open it you're faced with annoying music BLASTED over your own when in the gym and typically have to endure it for 5 seconds before you can skip. It then is the same every time you click on an exercise to check the form. I will be finding another app to use from now on.

Well I'm certainly no exercise professional and don't claim to be one, I have to torso of a adolescent boy. With that saud thus app is fine for day to day lifting but I just wish it listed more excercises. I was working on my back yesterday and although I found some of the exercises on the app there where others I didn't see like reverse butterfly or lawnmowers. Not a deal breaker, I do like recording my workouts on this app. Here's to going from zero to hero in 2019.

It's a very useful app for keeping track workout routines and progress. However, ads are very intrusive and constantly pop up, and recently the app has been asking permission to access my phone storage camera location and photos. All of which are not needed when tracking my progress. After denying and asking the app not to ask again, it consistently asks for it to have permission to keep asking me to turn on those services. Very annoying and shady, other than that it's works well and has lots of useful information. Just stop asking to access parts of my phone you don't need.

Best gym app for beginners and advance. Simple to use but with a lot depth. Pics, videos, and descriptions of each exercise and lift. Also a journal to keep track of your weight and reps. Also has pre-planned workout routines to target certain muscle groups. Well worth the $$. If you're on the fence about it just do it like I did.

It's literally a waste of time. If you can't afford to pay a subscription, you will be bombarded with ads after each and every click. It's ok to show ads after looking into 2-3 exercises, but showing ads after each exercise is way too much.

Do not use this app, you'll regret it! The free version started fine, but soon they added commercial. Every single time I check a workout, I got to swallow an advertisement. Every freaking time! But behold, that wasn't the worst, one morning all my progress, everything that I was keeping track, was gone! The garbage app replaced all my numbers with some decimal, say .17! I hate this app and never in million years using it again.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
It could be that you, unintentionally, pressed on Weight(lbs) button, beside the box where you input your weight, in the exercise section. With an update, we removed the possibility of changing weight unit from the exercise section, and leave it in settings section so you will no longer experience â€œspontaneousâ€ unit conversion.
Regards,
VGFIT Team

scraped_reviews.content: Like every other app I thought it would be useless, few seconds of app browsing was all it took for that perspective to change. Amazing delicious recipes and outstanding exercises for many muscles around the human body. I am certain that I will obtain guaranteed results with the help of my determination, diet, and exercice also not forgetting THIS APP, as without it I would be doing many exercises that could've potentially gave me negative results. Thank you for a great app.

Terrible app. I assume this app exists only to rope you in to in app purchases. Can't enter the workout info (weight and reps) during your workout. If you exit the app to something else between sets, the app reverts to the home screen and does not save your info. You are better off manually recording your workouts on paper or in your notes app.

Very limited App. Needs more varied exercises. Add more glute workouts. Add more resistance band workouts. Workouts should target more muscle groups. Could be revamped to be more interesting or challenging. This seems like an App for beginners who are just starting from scratch. Inputting data for your own weights and reps is cumbersome. Whenever you pause your workout during a time interval, it resets your workout and starts you back at set 1. Lacks the ability for you to skip rest times!

Wonderful application for understanding workouts category wise. It always helps in understanding right positions, movements for each exercise with photos and videos. So whenever i start the workout of the day, I make plan with combination of 5-6 exercises of a particular category, for example chest or back. Then it always helps in proper planning and scheduling our exercises. Also it has lots of variety of exercises which can be done at home without machines.

Are there any reasons to use fitness apps? NO! Iâ€™m not a fan of all these useless training courses. I want just to lose weight and forget about training forever. So, in this app all the exercises I am interested in are blocked and should be prepaid. You lose clients, developers! I choose Sworkout and vote for its 30 days challenge.

Tromendous amount of training and well calibrated for my 6,1ft tall person. All videos are downloadable making this app more useful then others since it is also offline once the videos are on phone. I take away 2 stars because the app assumes training is only at gym and thus offers no home bodyweight training. You need a minimum of equipments at home to fully use this app.

I've been using this app for a year now. What I really love about this app is, it keeps me on pace. I use the built in timer so I'm in and out the gym in less than 35 minutes, when I'm not doing cardio. For ex. I set my sets to 5 I set the timer to exercise for 40 seconds per set and set the timer to rest 45 seconds between sets. This has saved me an exorbitant amount of time in the gym. No time to talk...

Very helpful short video clips that demonstrate the proper and safe way to strengthen muscle groups. Multiple exercises for each muscle group. Sometimes when I am in the gym I get bored with my usual routine. All I have to do is use this app to give me fresh exercises to do to peak my interest again. Nice app.

This app makes the workouts simple to understand and you can do most of them at home as long as you have dumbbells, I've had it for a year now and with nonstop daily workouts I'm very happy to say that I have abs now!!! I'm so proud of my accomplishment and I would've not been able to do it without this app, I'm so happy and will forever recommend it to anyone looking to improve their physical appearance! You get more workouts with premium but the free one will do as long as you're consistent!

Really love this app. What for me would set it apart from others would be if you could add notes on to the exercises. That are a bit more personal to your work out. So you could add on to the over row a note saying "make sure you squeeze you muscles when bar high and aim for a 3 second lowering of the bar" this would just be some top tips for myself and would just let me tailor the experience more. Another one for me a tip I got from a fellow. "To engage chest on bench press imagine bending bar"

Used to be a great app, I even payed for the ad free version and how do they repay their PAYING customers that helped fund the app? By deleting all of the custom workouts that took hours to put together because they are now using a subscription-based service and want me to pay 10 bucks a month.. Uninstalling this app and would not recommend to anyone!

The best free app I've used. Yes, some parts need a payment but it has so many free videos that I don't need to pay for the additional videos. Maybe further down my fitness/muscle building journey I'll pay, but for now this fits me well. I love that I can choose an area I want to work, select the video and the demos are just there. Brilliant app, thank you.

There is no way to even try this app properly. The ads to buy premium are every time popping up for 5 seconds, loud, On each click. So annoying! The costume workout is so simple, and requires whole input for each rep. So it's more app usage than gym :/ Though the videos for explanation are very good! And a big range of exercises,!

Good free app for keeping track of your exercises, weights and reps. Also good for ideas of different exercise for targeted areas. One addition I would add to the app if possible is a notes section where you can type and save notes for yourself. I feel this might help people remember to do things in between their resting days and before their next workout.

Been trying a variety of fitness apps trying to find one that did what this app does. Being able to simply track your progress on each exercise, seeing your previous results for that exercise as you do so, is simple but effective. For me anyway. Yet other apps do not do this simple thing. I recommend creating a custom workout, you don't have to do them on particular days or even in order, but it helps organise the exercises you do and in groups you do them by.

I provides a variety of exercises n I'd effective, however, when I started the app it asked me if I wanted to download all the videos of the workouts. I downloaded them since I didn't have internet in the place I was working out so this was perfect for me. The first day went smoothly bu the next day none of the videos were loading and it kept saying to wait for an I ternet connection.

Not bad, nice for weightlifting but... I would like to be able to add exercise categories (upper body, lower body, full body) instead of the more specific categories they have. I also can't add a fitness class or game of badminton, so it is not comprehensive. Also it needs a feedback menu item.

Update Videos Now not fitting the mobile screen size (Note20Ultra) Very Useful 10/10 This App is helping me to keep track of my daily workouts, and see different training. 1. Keeping Records for daily Training. and history, performance, and charts are helpful to track the progress. 2. There are More options to create customized Exercise. I would like to suggest if possible to have an average (or approximate) calories burned during the exercise, then having a Monthly Summary for total calories.

From all the fitness and exercise app i have downloaded in the past, i can say that this one is the best so far. It has stayed in my phone ever since i downloaded it. All i ever want in an exercise app is (1) what exercise should i do for x muscles, and (2) how do i do it properly. This app categorizes the exercises by the muscles they train, AND provided pictures that are very clear and easy to understand AND a short and small video to literally just demonstrate it without any bs. 10/10!

App has been great, would have given 4 stars, one star deduction because it has WAY too many adds, they pop up between every single set of exercises entered! Very anoying. Update, another star deduction. There is no way to transfer the app data to my new phone! I just got a new phone and my workout history, custom exercises, and routines did not automatically transfer. There appears to be no backup or restore function at all in the app either. That's a huge frustration.

This app has decided to become unsufferable with its fake "adbreak" that gets longer and longer every time I open the app. It got to 17 seconds every time I open an exercise page. That's not incentivising me to purchase the pro version, it makes me wanna throw my phone out! I'm just copying my stats unto another app and will uninstall this mental torture of an app.

Great app, let down by subscription billing model. I love the pictorial guides for targeted muscle groups, links to good quality videos, and the fact I can use all this to build a great workout schedule. What I HATE is the fact that if I want to use some of the extra features I have to subscribe. One off payments to remove ads, and to unlock specific areas would be a better idea. For example I don't need the nutrition section, but I would like the option to look at the pre-defined routines.

title: Notion: Notes, Tasks, AI
description:
Prepare for Back to School with Notion! Organize class notes, track homework assignments, and manage projects easily. Keep track of your grades and goals, and improve your academic performance with Notion tools.

"AI's everything app" â€” Forbes

Notion is a productivity app where you can write, plan, and organize your notes, projects, tasks and more - all in one place. Ask Notion AI about project updates, upcoming tasks, and suggestions for a more streamlined workflow.

Simplify writing notes, project and task management, and collaboration. Whether for personal, student or professional use, Notion scales to meet your individual needs with customization tools for everyone.

FREE FOR PERSONAL USE
â€¢ Create as many notes, docs, and content as you want.
â€¢ Use one of thousands of templates to get started.

FREE TO TRY WITH YOUR TEAM
â€¢ Millions run on Notion every day, from next-generation startups to established enterprises.
â€¢ Import Google Docs, PDFs, and other content types easily to get started
â€¢ Write and organize meeting notes, or transcribe with AI.
â€¢ Collaboration and team work at your fingertips, in one connected workspace.
â€¢ Connect tools like Figma, Slack, and GitHub to Notion.

FREE FOR STUDENTS
â€¢ Your study planner, class notes, to do lists and more, your way. Loved by millions of students worldwide.
â€¢ Get organized for your best school year yet with beautiful, customizable templates created by students, for students.

NOTES & DOCS
Communication is made efficient with Notion's flexible building blocks.
â€¢ Create docs with beautiful templates, images, to-dos, and 50+ more content types.
â€¢ Meeting notes, projects, design systems, pitch decks, and more.
â€¢ Find exactly what you need using Search with powerful filters to find content across your workspace.

TASKS & PROJECTS
Catch all details big and small in any workflow.
â€¢ Workflow manager: Create your own priority labels, status tags, and automations to choose the exact info you want to track.
â€¢ Capture every detail in a table. Break projects into manageable tasks to get the work done.

AI
One tool that does it all - search, generate, analyze, and chat - right inside Notion.
â€¢ Write better. Use Notion AI to help write and brainstorm.
â€¢ Get answers. Ask Notion AI questions about all your content and get answers in seconds.
â€¢ Autofill tables. Notion AI turns overwhelming data into clear, actionable information  â€” automatically.

SYNCS WITH BROWSER, MAC, AND WINDOWS APPS.
â€¢ Pick up on mobile where you left off on desktop.

MORE PRODUCTIVITY. FEWER TOOLS.
â€¢ Track to-dos, write notes, create docs, and manage projects in one connected workspace.
descriptionHTML:
Prepare for Back to School with Notion! Organize class notes, track homework assignments, and manage projects easily. Keep track of your grades and goals, and improve your academic performance with Notion tools.

"AI's everything app" â€” Forbes

Notion is a productivity app where you can write, plan, and organize your notes, projects, tasks and more - all in one place. Ask Notion AI about project updates, upcoming tasks, and suggestions for a more streamlined workflow.

Simplify writing notes, project and task management, and collaboration. Whether for personal, student or professional use, Notion scales to meet your individual needs with customization tools for everyone.

FREE FOR PERSONAL USE
â€¢ Create as many notes, docs, and content as you want.
â€¢ Use one of thousands of templates to get started.

FREE TO TRY WITH YOUR TEAM
â€¢ Millions run on Notion every day, from next-generation startups to established enterprises.
â€¢ Import Google Docs, PDFs, and other content types easily to get started
â€¢ Write and organize meeting notes, or transcribe with AI.
â€¢ Collaboration and team work at your fingertips, in one connected workspace.
â€¢ Connect tools like Figma, Slack, and GitHub to Notion.

FREE FOR STUDENTS
â€¢ Your study planner, class notes, to do lists and more, your way. Loved by millions of students worldwide.
â€¢ Get organized for your best school year yet with beautiful, customizable templates created by students, for students.

NOTES & DOCS
Communication is made efficient with Notion's flexible building blocks.
â€¢ Create docs with beautiful templates, images, to-dos, and 50+ more content types.
â€¢ Meeting notes, projects, design systems, pitch decks, and more.
â€¢ Find exactly what you need using Search with powerful filters to find content across your workspace.

TASKS & PROJECTS
Catch all details big and small in any workflow.
â€¢ Workflow manager: Create your own priority labels, status tags, and automations to choose the exact info you want to track.
â€¢ Capture every detail in a table. Break projects into manageable tasks to get the work done.

AI
One tool that does it all - search, generate, analyze, and chat - right inside Notion.
â€¢ Write better. Use Notion AI to help write and brainstorm.
â€¢ Get answers. Ask Notion AI questions about all your content and get answers in seconds.
â€¢ Autofill tables. Notion AI turns overwhelming data into clear, actionable information â€” automatically.

SYNCS WITH BROWSER, MAC, AND WINDOWS APPS.
â€¢ Pick up on mobile where you left off on desktop.

MORE PRODUCTIVITY. FEWER TOOLS.
â€¢ Track to-dos, write notes, create docs, and manage projects in one connected workspace.
summary: Write notes, plan projects and organize tasks easily in one connected workspace

scraped_reviews.content: I'm not sure I can say enough good things about Notion. I use it everyday, for so many things. It is my second brain! Notes, bookmarks, ideas, to-do lists, everything I need to keep track of and be able to find later, goes in there. it all syncs across devices and is constantly getting improved. It's seriously one of my favorite apps ever created

Okay, I'm in love with this app. I've always found that other productivity note apps were lacking one way or the other, so you've had to download two other apps that can do what the previous couldn't. I was simply searching for a smart checklist app, but notion is way beyond that. It's definitely worth taking the time to learn it, my scattered brain definitely feels more organized and not frustrated anymore.

The app deserves 0 stars. Use the browser insteadâ€”just save the website as an icon. I love Notion on desktop, but the app is useless. Bitwarden tries to save everything I type, some desktop features are missing for no reason, and thereâ€™s no link to location servicesâ€”so you canâ€™t record where you took a photo or filled gas. Theyâ€™re clearly slacking in app development. This 1 star is for the app, not Notion overall.

I absolutely love Notion. But, mobile is much less seamless to use than the desktop. I want to give 5â­ but there are lots of tiny things in mobile that cause frustration - database resetting at top after inserting new page, selecting cells is not intuitive, the app breaks when trying to drag cells, etc - so I end up not using it to track my workouts even though I have an amazing workspace to do so. I'll keep trying, but I hope they keep improving!

The mobile version has never been as convenient or helpful as the desktop version, which is obviously expected. However currently the app is pretty much unusable for me because every single field is registering as a password field, so I keep getting Bitwarden pop-ups to save my password. Not sure if this is a Notion issue or BW, but I haven't seen it on any other app or website. I would have to completely turn off Bitwarden autofill to fix it, which isn't worth it.

Folder ðŸ“‚! Sounds trivial, but necessary for an app like this. I need a simple way to group and organise my work. Folders are excellent for that, and it's crazy that the app doesn't have it. Pages and sub-pages quickly clutter up your workspace and it's annoying. That's the only thing holding me from ditching other notes and word processing apps.

Basically good but this is the only app that doesn't work with a bluetooth keyboard. All other apps do, I'm writing this review on my bluetooth keyboard, but when I try to write in Notion, after a typing a few characers, the app switches focus away from text input, making note taking impossible - in a note taking app! Defeats the purpose. Web search confirms that's an issue for years but wasn't solved yet.

I use Notion for everything. Literally. From work (task management, documentations) to personal shopping lists, to-dos, research, meal planner, recipes, etc. Their customer support is one of the best I've met so far, very responsive (didn't expect to get answers so fast, even if I was on a free plan at that time), very friendly and solution-oriented (no copy-paste). The tool itself is super flexible and well designed.

While the web app is very versatile and is fantastic for organization, the mobile version is absolutely insufferable and it doesn't seem like the developers have any interest in improving it. - it's slow, buggy, and destroys my battery - the only font size is too frickin' big for a phone - today I pasted a numbered list from another program and while I was editing, it reversed the order of the whole list and would not let me undo. What the tarnation. I don't even know what happened there.

This was a fantastic app and superior alternative to most writing docs until the AI rebrand. And, sure, everything has an AI feature nowadaysâ€“ that which you don't have to use if you don't wish to. But Notion in particular seems insistent on shoving it down their users throats (for lack of a better term)... Basically, it's far too annoying to put up with. And with no obligation to, I will be searching for a better place to keep my work.

A fine, basic list-making app. It updates quickly and accurately between platforms, which was the main function I was looking for. However, there's no way to print directly from the platform, and you can't change the size or font, can't use bold or italics, and can't do anything about the (sometimes funky) line spacing. Still, it's my go-to list app, and that says something!

Great app, even on the free version. I wish that it had certain mobile features such as using a line break in the same block, and I wish that there was a mode that allowed me to write some more free notes without necessarily having to sort them, but otherwise it is great. If those two things were changed, it would be a perfect five stars.

I love it!!! I really really wish it was so much easier to use in Tablet and Phone, but in PC is so easy to use, you just gotta understand the concept of what everything does, and that can easily be done with a youtube search! regardless of that. is so amazingly neat and im so glad is free! I hope i hope they don't start getting greedy like others app, that's how I landed here. because other apps were getting to the point where I couldn't use anything and Notion gives me such freedom. Thank you

Love Notion on other platforms, horrible mobile port. I love and use Notion as my main notes and creation program, but the mobile port does not work well. I can't tell you how many times I'll be typing, hit the back space, button to erase what I've written, and it moves the cursor to somewhere random on the page and starts deleting from there. Not user friendly to get to text options, or other feature buttons on the horizontal scroll menu bar.

I have been using Notion now for about a year. My entire business was based on Excel prior to this and I did try several competitors before determining Notion beats them all. It's genuinely a sandbox with unlimited potential. I run my business, the businesses of multiple clients and my personal life, tasks and finances from here. Combine Notion's capabilities with third-party app integrations and you've got one of the most powerful tools out there right now. 100/100 recommend.

The app is probably great, but it often logs you out and you have to re-enter your password. When you're in a hurry, I save all my data in another app; it's easier than searching for a long, complex 2FA password. Now Samsung has sent a notification that Notion will be sent to dormant apps due to inactivity. Here's a guide on how to make the app less user-friendly.

I find the website service pretty great. It's flexible and I use it all the time. The app on the other hand is a very poor experience. As of recent it does not load. I have to force stop it and the re open it. Even then it takes about 7-10 seconds to load. It's also sometimes not saved my data only to find that out later when I head to the website version. My main fix is to re-install. But it's growing old. I've been heading to Google Keep anymore for notes.

I really like notion and find it really useful, so I don't want to give it up, but I run into major issues the Android app. Trying to select a favorite note to switch to right after opening the app sometimes causes a crash. Additionally, sometimes when reopening the app, the note I want will be open but then quickly replaced with a message that says this content doesn't exist, which is really frustrating when I know the note does still exist. I've had to switch back to other tools.

Haven't even used it for a week and I absolutely love it. However, there's a couple things keeping me from a 5-star review. First, I'm left-handed, and that shouldn't make a difference, but I'm accidentally opening the side menu far too often, when I really just want to scroll sideways. Second, I want to see an option that lets you open links and bookmarks in your default browser, instead of a webview that I'm just going to reopen in my main browser anyway.

The interface looks good and I love the way it's set up. I love the variety of ways to connect notes. But it's difficult to do basic things sometimes. It's complicated to even just select and copy text in your notes on Android. For a Note taking app, that's inexcusable. And it's so distracting! It's a basic task I never have to think about in any other app. So to keep my flow of thoughts going when I'm taking notes, I'll have to find another app. I hope to be notified if this is ever fixed.

So far it's been great. So far, I have only used it for to do list and have yet to explore the entire capabilities. To developers, I would recommend having the ability to increase the font size and select area for Android Widget (favorite items). For checkboxes, please allow the ability to hide checked items. In addition, when retyping an item have it autofill to previous item.

It's actually a decent note taking app when you are connected to the Internet. But it's is worse than worthless when you are out of cell service and offline like when out of town, or on an airplane, or in the driveway and the Wi-Fi is too weak to work but the phone won't switch to 5G... The app closes repeatedly but will sort-of work for a minute or two and then close and lose your note. I lost a bunch of stuff and it seems that the whole folder is corrupted now... It's a mess.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback! Notion now works offline on mobile. You can now access and edit your marked pages without internet. Changes sync automatically when you reconnect: notion.com/help/use-pages-offline. We'd love to hear your thoughts once you've had a chance to try it!

scraped_reviews.content: On desktop Notion is a godsend, but getting anything done in this app is like pulling teeth while on fire it's so finicky and difficult to find what you're looking for. Plus if you leave the app for more than a minute, it puts you back at the homepage, which gets annoying fast if you have long or in-depth pages. Notion is a great program, just not on mobile. Also they need to add a toggle to disable AI integration so bad I'm so tired of seeing it. I straight up just do not care about it.

i have used this app on many platforms for many months and ive noticed that on pc, it's has no issues at all. on mobile, there are a couple things that happen, like a little bit of lagging or words jumping, but thats very minor. on my tablet, its about the same, just slightly different. however, i always see the team making improvements to the app! highly recommend using Notion because of its blend of note taking, organization and aesthetics.

Notion's databases are amazing, and I love that you can see the data in multiple ways. Awesome. But, I don't care for the way the handle backlinks - kind of a lazy developer way to do it - and the icon for linked pages is obnoxious, ruining for me an otherwise pretty UI. The biggest thing is that you cannot store the data offline, locally. I work for a Fortune 500 company that doesn't allow info to be stored online by a 3rd party. Users, companies want to own their data. Bad.

This is a fantastic system that can be used for way more than just note-taking! I use it to organize and run my online business and track my life tasks, events & meal planning. When I was in college, it was great for keeping track of assignments, notes, and information, even drafting my thesis paper inside the app instead of Google Docs or Word, which you could do and link or embed. I also keep a list of wishlist items and so much more! This is one of the most used apps on my phone!

It's really easy to use! It's made writing a breeze, and unlike Google Docs, my works won't be sold to AI companies to train AI writing services. My main pet-peeves are being unable to indent a paragraph -- but that can be easily solved with the space bar; and the use of some AI within the app (they aren't required, I just refuse to use those functions, but I don't personally approve of the use of AI).

It has amazing potential but the free version is just too limited. For example I can't even add one "to do" to my to do list because I don't have any blocks left. I've added 3 items to a selling tracker, and a few items to a health tracker. And... That's the capacity of the free version apparently which sucks and I can't really test it's full functionality. I use it for work and pay (even tho it also has limits? Weird). But my work and private life are separate and I don't want 2 subs.

I love Notion. I've always had trouble keeping myself organized and keeping appointments. With Notion, I don't miss any appointments, and I can do everything in one place. I think it's great and would recommend it to anyone struggling to keep organized. I also love the share option so others can comment/ read if you chose. I think it's awesome!

Finding out that Notion didn't have an offline mode was an unpleasant surprise for me. I needed to make an important note, but didn't have reception or WiFi. Ended up just writing in Obsidian. On that note (ha), no other note taking app is missing this critical feature. I started to move my notes to Notion, but now will be moving back away until it has a stable offline mode. It's just not acceptable, especially if you're charging money.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thanks for the feedback and advocating for offline functionality! We're happy to share that it's finally here. To get started, simply mark any page as 'Available offline' from the page menu. Learn more here: notion.com/help/use-pages-offline. We'd love to hear your thoughts once you've had a chance to try it.

scraped_reviews.content: I love notion, i use it for a lot of things, but on the tablet, idk if its just my cheap device, but it's really slow to load up anything. That, and i use portrait mode almost exclusively, and it frustrates me how it isnt like the phone version, where when i have a page with multiple columns, it'll display them one over each other, so you can read it and it doesnt crowd anything. But bc i have the tablet version, it displays the colums side by side, so i cant read it at all.

I'm really enjoying the app so far! My only issue is that it creates temporary files in my gallery, which I have to delete regularly. Other than that, I love how well organized it is; even the free version. Being able to create multiple folders for things like gaming notes and important info like doctorâ€™s notes is super helpful and makes it easy to find what I need. It's visually appealing too : I'm glad I can change the color of different notes and I think having the emoji is a cute add on.

Nifty service for note taking, and so much more. I love that the free membership allows for some limited sharing, which is a great way when you want to share grocery lists with a spouse or party plans with a friend, without needing everyone to have a paid account (I currently have a paid account through work). Plus you can create the equivolent of your own databases. Could use some improvements on supporting things like recurring tasks, and integration with external calendars...but I love it.

After installing and signing up, I found someone had shared a workspace with me, containing one shortened link and no text, which I assumed was spam or worse. I had never accepted any share, so I don't know what it was there. I couldn't find any way to remove the share from my account, and there were many times that things didn't work, such as the settings not loading. I gave up, deleted my account, and purged the app. The templates looked like maybe they would be useful, but not revolutionary.

I've had Notion for a few months and I am still discovering all it offers. You can literally create an entire workflow and productivity powerhouse within this one app and delete all the rest. The template gallery helps give me inspiration for how I want things set up, like meal logs, journal templates, etc. I like how they added a free version but they also provide easy ways to accumulate credit to pay for premium. Because of it, I got 5 months worth of Notion and have not paid a penny.

Absolutely love Notion on desktop, but I'm considering moving to a different app due to the terrible mobile experience. Startup is much slower than competitors, taking well over 5 seconds, which is annoying and troublesome when I just want to jot down some notes or check my todo-list quickly. In addition, it crashes about 50% of the time which just makes it worse.   If the development team just put a little bit more focus on the mobile side, Notion would definitely be my go-to!

Notion is a very robust tool if you have the time to invest into it. I have been using it regularly for the past several months and its systems are still a bit confusing. I've watched multiple videos to unlcok more of Notions potential but you really are learning a second language. I use this across all of my devices but I'm sad to say if you're a chromebook user you might be out of luck. It really just doesn't work well. Certain keys won't type and the menu button doesn't work at all.

I moved over here since Evernote trashed their free plan, and it's a bit more of a learning curve, but I really like it so far! A few complaints, though. I don't like that columns don't appear on mobile. It also loads very slowly, images and emojis take a while to pop in and even plain text takes too long. There's also no way I know of to search for text within a page (like a Control+F on PC), which is a super basic function for a notes app to have!!

Notion seems to be much, much more oriented to desktop users, ones who always have a steady Internet connection and can load things quickly. I primarily use Notion on my phone, on normally slow data or WiFi connections, which can make loading the app and trying to quickly save notes a hassle, especially if they don't upload before you close the app and they're lost! Unfortunately, I'm going to be switching to Google Keep. I love the complexity Notion allows in notes, though.

I give the Desktop a 5 star review. The mobile has bugs, takes a long time to open, sometimes have to force the app closed. Other times when saving my work, get the spinning circle of death and loose my work. Having to force the app close to get it working again. I keep using the mobile app, knowing they fix these problems and it will be just as good as the desktop.

I thought it was just me! I love Notion. The database function, calendar view, toggle lists!! It's everything Evernote doesn't have and I want!! However... my grievances are the same as others. After entering in data, long texts, what have you; I will find that ALL of my work has been deleted. It just isn't there. I've updated the app, restarted phone and tablet (which has a high working processor) and it's gone... and have retyped things just for maybe 1/2 of it to stay. What are we doing wrong

The companion app to the web/desktop version really needs a lot of optimization work. If all you need to do is read what youve already written, maybe check off some stuff, the app works fine. But doing something as simple as typing in a note lags and misses keystrokes. You have to type very slowly and wait for every letter to show up before typing the next one. Also, startup is 5+ seconds. Hopefully the team works on performance.

Notion is great on it's own on desktop machines, this app has sucked too much pond scum. For a while it was almost usable, then each upgrade seemed to be getting slower and slower, recently I've not been able to get the app to reliably even give me an error, much less actually do something useful it now works on four of six Android devices, it is painfully slow on a couple of the newer devices (July 14, 2020 update)

I love notion and use it all the time, on desktop and my phone. I have used the iOS version and I would say its better. The startup is slow, overall the app is slow, and I apparently type too fast for it to keep up; even though I feel the vibration from me hitting the key, letters are often left out of my text which makes this app sometimes a hassel to use if i need to quickly take a note during my day then put my phone away.

It used to be good, but the recent updates make it so slow. Opening the app and loading my pages takes a noticeably longer time. I don't even have that many pages (< 50). Plus, they added a new paid feature (AI) and force you to see the prompts for a paid feature! They don't have any way to turn it off. I know because I asked. Bad customer service. If you get locked out of your account by accident they won't help you either.

This product raises the bar for personal organization software. I've used Onenote, Evernote, Trello and a number of other apps of this type. None of them are even close to Notion's user interface. You're literally given a blank page to add anything you want to keep track of. With the variety of templates and media included, I've found every feature I needed. My absolute favorite is an inline database. You create customer entry forms for what is essentially a spreadsheet. Worth every cent!

This is a big program and took some time to learn but it's amazing. I am wondering how I lived without it for so long. It's so nice to have everything in one app and not all over the place. Reminds me of junior high when you had everything in your backpack. Now it's in a neat app. I just wish it had some of the abilities a note taking app has. Like handwriting to text, drawing ect. It would also be nice if cut and pasting from outside the app into the app was easier.

Update: lowering rating because I just logged in and all of my entries are GONE and I'm pretty upset about it *** I love the organization of this app, but it is far easier to build your templates and sections on a computer first and then utilize the mobile app to take your notes and copy/paste items you want to save. There's a small learning curve. I'm always looking for that perfect organizational app and this one is currently my favorite.

I have been looking for an app like this for a LONG time! The only downfall I see, is you can't pick up the section and move it to where you want it. Instead you have to do columns. However, it is great for keeping all your documents in one place! And it's awesome that if you change someone on one page, it changes the information and ALL pages. Unless you put it in as it's own database great for keeping copy's of my submitted school work and bills where they are fast and easy to find.

So far...Robust. It's a learning curve but promising, more so if you can think outside the box. No widgets. No permissions for contacts, only certain features make phone numbers clickable, trial and error. Sharing difficulties, to some apps like evernote.. it shares as a sign-in to notion. Probably goes to intended note but too many steps for my need so I left off there. We shall see.

title: Telegram
description:
Pure instant messaging â€” simple, fast, secure, and synced across all your devices. One of the top 5 most downloaded apps in the world with over 1 billion active users.

FAST: Telegram is the fastest messaging app on the market, connecting people via a unique, distributed network of data centers around the globe.

SYNCED: You can access your messages from all your phones, tablets and computers at once. Telegram apps are standalone, so you donâ€™t need to keep your phone connected. Start typing on one device and finish the message from another. Never lose your data again.

UNLIMITED: You can send media and files, without any limits on their type and size. Your entire chat history will require no disk space on your device, and will be securely stored in the Telegram cloud for as long as you need it. 

SECURE: We made it our mission to provide the best security combined with ease of use. Everything on Telegram, including chats, groups, media, etc. is encrypted using a combination of 256-bit symmetric AES encryption, 2048-bit RSA encryption, and Diffieâ€“Hellman secure key exchange. 

100% FREE & OPEN: Telegram has a fully documented and free API for developers, open source apps and verifiable builds to prove the app you download is built from the exact same source code that is published. 

POWERFUL: You can create group chats with up to 200,000 members, share large videos, documents of any type (.DOCX, .MP3, .ZIP, etc.) up to 2 GB each, and even set up bots for specific tasks. Telegram is the perfect tool for hosting online communities and coordinating teamwork.

RELIABLE: Built to deliver your messages using as little data as possible, Telegram is the most reliable messaging system ever made. It works even on the weakest mobile connections. 

FUN: Telegram has powerful photo and video editing tools, animated stickers and emoji, fully customizable themes to change the appearance of your app, and an open sticker/GIF platform to cater to all your expressive needs.

SIMPLE: While providing an unprecedented array of features, we take great care to keep the interface clean. Telegram is so simple you already know how to use it.

PRIVATE: We take your privacy seriously and will never give any third parties access to your data. You can delete any message you ever sent or received for both sides, at any time and without a trace. Telegram will never use your data to show you ads.

For those interested in maximum privacy, Telegram offers Secret Chats. Secret Chat messages can be programmed to self-destruct automatically from both participating devices. This way you can send all types of disappearing content â€” messages, photos, videos, and even files. Secret Chats use End-to-End Encryption to ensure that a message can only be read by its intended recipient.

We keep expanding the boundaries of what you can do with a messaging app. Donâ€™t wait years for older messengers to catch up with Telegram â€” join the revolution today.

For those interested in maximum privacy, Telegram offers Secret Chats. Secret Chat messages can be programmed to self-destruct automatically from both participating devices. This way you can send all types of disappearing content â€” messages, photos, videos, and even files. Secret Chats use End-to-End Encryption to ensure that a message can only be read by its intended recipient.

We keep expanding the boundaries of what you can do with a messaging app. Donâ€™t wait years for older messengers to catch up with Telegram â€” join the revolution today.
summary: Telegram is a messaging app with a focus on speed and security.

scraped_reviews.content: This app used to be great. It was very secure and easy to navigate. I've been using Telegram since the beginning of 2018, and I might have to leave the app soon because I'm sick of having 10+ strangers/bots message me each day trying to scam me. There should be a way where people can only message you if you add them or something because the nonstop scam/spam harassment is wildly irritating.

I wish I could give it 4 or 5 stars but there are a few blaring issues that have caused me quite some grief. The first and most being that in group chats, if you join the chat after everyone else, it isn't possible to see the previous messages unless a setting (which is by default, turned off) gets turned in. Only messages from that point on are shown as well. I accidentally got kicked from a group where we look back at old messages (DnD chat). There's no fix to this either. I cried for an hour.

it's alright. it sucks you can't nickname people but my biggest gripe with it is the notifications. after many hours of googling, I've come to the conclusion that notifications have been broken for a long time. notifications have priority levels unlikely most other apps. if notification priority is "high" or "urgent", it vibrates like normal but bypasses do-not-disturb rules. if the notification priority is set to "medium" or "low", it doesn't play at all.

Paying for auto translate? It's a risk.ðŸ˜¢ I want to love this app. When it works? Awesome, particularly for mulyi-language teams. But for months,most of the time the auto translate has been completely or mostly broken. Right now, it is both broken AND the "translate to (my Lang)"/"leave Original" button is missing. Why am I paying? And no refund nor delays on payments. This is a management issue. Your actions are telling me to cancel my subscription. ðŸ™„ðŸ˜¢

The app was the best, but sadly now is one of the worst. They are locking key features behind a premium subscription. Features such as being able to block spam messages. They do nothing to remove bot and spam accounts allowing your inbox to remain open, keeping your inbox security behind a subscription paywall. none of which existed before. Steer clear from telegram, there are much better options now.

I'm sick of paying for premium, only to have the translation service NOT WORK, more often than it works! that's the ONLY REASON why I bought premium! it worked great for a couple of months, and then it went down for a month or so, with no explanation. and since then it will come back on for a short time, and then go back off again, with no explanation, no customer service, nothing. They rope you in (scam you) by making you pay for a YEARLY subscription.... then they don't keep it running.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The translation feature is temporarily unavailable while some technical fixes are being made. We apologize for the inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: The spam is a bit out of hand but I like that it displays "not an official account" and "not in your contact list" to block/report quickly. My only frustration is the warning of "3 login attempts" where my only response prompts are "it wasn't me" or "it was me." With no information how can I tell if it was me or not? Anyways, keep up the good work.

Something broke. for 2 days the translation feature doesn't work at all in this app or the X version. I can use Google to translate back but that is a pain. I've had premium for over a year. My friend and I both have premium and both are getting "Translations are currently disabled." No app updates available and have gone through and tried all the troubleshooting tips. Even uninstalled and reinstalled and nothing changed! update: 3 days later and still no translation
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The translation feature is temporarily unavailable while some technical fixes are being made. We apologize for the inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: Requires a subscription in order to prevent non-contacts from messaging you. I have had half a dozen different spam accounts message me over the course of the past 2 days, and I am considering uninstalling his app. I have contact with certain people only through this app, which is the only reason I am still using it at time of writing. I am just about out of patience. My privacy as a user should not be reliant on a subscription, so I refuse to purchase a subscription based on that principal.

this was the best instant messaging app back in 2016 and had great QOL improvements. But it's become increasingly obvious how profit motivated it's owners are. the platform is rife with abuse, bots, and advertisements now. I get messages from bots at least 1-3 times a week. it's also not as secure as you'd like it to be. I'm looking forward to the day I can uninstall it for good.

it's been a great app, up until 3 days ago, when the translator button decided to disappear. I had to pay for the subscription, just so I could have the translation option. I have tried everything to try and fix it, including the uninstall/reinstall. It is completely gone from the app, including on my fiancee's app too. Asked for help through the "volunteers" section of the app... still no response. nothing. how do we fix it? and if not fixed, do we get our money back from the subscription? ðŸ˜¡
scraped_reviews.replyContent: The translation feature is temporarily unavailable while some technical fixes are being made. We apologize for the inconvenience.

scraped_reviews.content: update: 8/19/25. still not working! It's the actual telegram "stories" at the top that is frozen.(not contacts) So there is no holding in place to try to remove, so I can't use or see the top 2 chats I need..... Need to fix the stories now at top. It hides and covers all the top conversations so I can't click on them and can't remove the stories easily. please make this so you can hide it or remove the stories you don't want to see and don't want to be forced to have to watch them all.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Stories take up no extra space in the Telegram UI â€“ but if you'd prefer not to see stories from certain contacts, hold down on their profile picture at the top of your screen and select 'Hide Stories'.

This does not affect your chat with the user, and they won't know that you hid their stories.

scraped_reviews.content: used to be amazing. have used it for 8 years. half of the features hardly function at all anymore. and if you want a half-decent experience, you have to pay. it used to be a GIVEN (and always should be?) to allow message requests only from known contacts. now you have to pay, and bots are infiltrating the platform. I can't think of a single reason why that feature is now behind a paywall. it's becoming unusable from the spam alone. video memos have been broken for months. voice memos delete.

The features and function of the app and service are actually really good. Unfortunately it's ruined by crashing literally ever 5 minutes on all my Samsung devices. update: 7-2025 still crashes.... still restricted. no explanation. no responses.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience. Please contact recover@telegram.org, they handle banned phone number cases. Include phone number + country code of banned account, and details/context about the case. Never share your code with anyone, only use official apps, and ensure your devices are secured. Numbers can be unbanned if the case is a false positive.

scraped_reviews.content: good app BUT 1. even though I have it unchecked, the app still notifies me of EVERYONE that installs the app. 2. there's no indication that an incoming call is a video call....and when you answer, your camera is automatically on. I'm sure I'm not the only one to imagine how that can lead to unintended consequences 3. there's also some room for improvement in the call connectivity. on the plus side, stickers are Really nice and varied. the app doesn't use much device space.

telegram is full of a lot of scammers. I kept getting added to groups that I never requested to be in. The groups were so-called jobs that let's you do simple things, but obviously, like most, they never pay out or they want you to pay to get money. I tried a few to get an impression of what telegram is, I wouldn't recommend this chat app to anyone.

Edit: this is still a premium only feature, and it shouldn't be! So wrong!! I get so many unwanted messages, but I can't do anything about it because of this. It's just not right! Great app for the most part, but when I got a spam message this morning, I realized you cannot set privacy of who can message you without paying for premium. This should be a free setting ALWAYS!! Forcing users to pay to protect their privacy is sketchy, at best.

What's going on with this app? No matter what I do I'm bogged down with "updating" with what takes forever for anything to load. I've got a great internet connection and get the same thing with 5g cellular data. No other app has this problem and it's not the cache that needs cleared or having the app un-installed and reinstalled... It doesn't need chat memory cleared either bc I've done all that. I can't use any feature and nothing loads because it's *updating*
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience. We've tried to fix the issue recently. Can you please check and if issue still there email us qa@telegram.org to provide more details about the issue. Please include #reviews in the email topic so we could easily find your email. Thank you in advance!

scraped_reviews.content: really just sick to death of not getting notifications. I'm in a group on Telegram that uses the app for really time sensitive orders and constantly ill check to find that a message came in without me being told, whether it was 5 minutes or an hour ago. this is only sometimes and not with every message, it's not my notification settings being off. all other messaging apps don't have this problem and I've missed out on some big opportunities thanks to this.

no privacy at all. denied app permission for contacts, app still synced them. even after finding that setting and turning it off, people with my number saved were auto-informed i had installed app and began messaging me. also getting messages from people i don't know that have my number saved from when it belonged to someone else. also getting random nudes, etc. unable to turn off random messaging without premium account. only got this app to use resistbot, will just go back to sms for that.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: We're sorry to hear that. Please verify that your mobile plan includes active SMS coverage. Confirm Google Play Services are enabled on your device and disable any active VPN. If issues persist, contact sms@telegram.org with your phone number in international format as the email subject.

scraped_reviews.replyContent: Sorry for the inconvenience. Never share your code with anyone, only use official apps, and ensure your devices are secured. Numbers can be unbanned if the case is a false positive.

scraped_reviews.content: Blocks screenshots. Charges you just to use their stupid "stars" which are like tokens you have to buy in order to make purchases in apps; ridiculously complicated and you should not have to pay for the privilege of paying - rip-off merchants. System doesn't work anyway, valid payment details are rejected as 'invalid' so it's a completely pointless exercise and a waste of your time. now I can't select multiply photos/ video in one message. When I do tap on clip, then swipe to the top, 'open in gallery'. Now I can attach only one file. I still able to send photo directly from my galllery. But. It send them as files, not like attached photo. Also I still could select multiply photos just from fast review, when I tap on the clip. It's worthless, because I want to send some photos from my favorites Everything was fine earlier.

My favorite messaging app, I choose this over WhatsApp whenever possible, but it seems to me recent updates are detracting from what used to be the best. What happened with the August update? I'm not able to change the notification tones for individual users. When I go to the contact info page, the "Notifications" link doesn't do anything anymore if long pressed. It used to let you choose a notification tone. Is it an oversight or intended?

Unbeatable Speed and Features! I use Telegram every day because it's the fastest and most reliable messenger out there. The instant sync across all my devices is flawless, and the ability to send massive files is a huge benefit. If you want a clean, powerful, and secure messaging experience with none of the usual clutter, this is the app to get. A definite 5/5 stars!

it's one of the Worst App. it's quite frustrating and disappointing. i have been trying to log in to this app for more than a week and i do not get the code to my number nor the issue email is looked after anybody. have sent at least 3 emails for this issue and no body replied. it's passing my patience level. The customer service of telegram is inexistent. they never reply to your email.

Telegram your app is very good but , the app is logging me out after exactly a day of logging in ! And I must do that every day to open the app . The only device that I open the account in is my phone and it's still doing that , please help me because it's so annoying, and I can't get another number to have another account , I don't even know how this problem will be solved.

I got force logged out on both my phone and tablet, not sure when exactly it happened or why it happened about within a week of me buying stars this happened, when I tried to re-sign in with my phone number it made me re-register from scratch, and all of my previous chats and telegram friends are gone and my purchased stars are gone aswell, I tried reaching out to telegram app support but its been about 2 weeks and still no response.

Can't log in on a new device. "High SMS Costs". Doesn't matter I did 2FA via email and I'm logged in on other devices, can't proceed anyway. Subscribed to Premium for a month. Then, out of a sudden, I was able to receive the verification code to the app on another device. So they didn't even use the SMS eventually, complaining it costs too much initially. So humiliating.

The search function in my saved messages is completely corrupted for a while on the app (not the pc version). It shows me the number of matches at the bottom, but viewing them and clicking on any of them doesn't do anything and I stay at the end of my chat. And when I click the up and down arrows the page refreshes at the bottom of my chat still.

Telegram is the best messenger app. I liked it a lot before the latest update arrival, which brought liquid glass style UI elements. Guys, I'm not an iPhone user. I don't need liquid glass style UI. You've kept the design on Android and iOS a little bit different for years and nobody had any problems with that. It was coherent for the platform it was on, which is more important. I wanted to add more arguments but reviews has length restrictions. Short version: Just add feature toggle pleaseðŸ™

honestly, it's pretty screwed up they won't let you moderate who can send you messages and audio messages unless you pay them money. This is why Spam accounts send you audio messages, people. because there's no way for us normal people to moderate it. You also need to go into your settings and turn off premium accounts being able to add you to groups. I woke up this morning to being added to a crypto group, AKA a data broker group. Not fun!

Recently, my Telegram does not load at all, neither with a proxy, nor with a VPN, nor with config. You can install any other Telegram, and it works the same way, and I can log into my account via the web. I am sorry for this problem. Telegram is amazing, and after 6 years of daily use, I am losing interest in it.

the problem I think is that, there is no select all media, let's say your app can't keep up then why don't you just limit it to 100 just like in manual select??
