summary: Food delivery from your favorite places. Order food, alcohol and more nearby

scraped_reviews.content: I'm going out of my way to write this. I had an order recently that got miss delivered. No picture for the order just a red screen. I issued my request of didn't receive food and wanted redeliver. Got instant credit instead. I was fine with it, but then I tried to order again today. I'm exhausted from the hassle. I tried to use my credit on 4 different stores and got one message. "Sorry we cant combine two or more payment methods." Try doordash instead never any issue like this.

I stopped using food service apps for a while bc of the prices, healthier eating, and bc more times than not, something is wrong. I've been using GH again for the past week and a half bc I can't really leave my house, and 2/4 deliveries have had incorrect items. GH's map also puts my unit at the end of our parking lot, so drivers get mixed up, especially at night. The bonuses are that the app always works and I have GH+ for free through Amazon Prime.

I wish I could include screenshots of interactions with the customer service. Firstly, on their app is nowhere to report missing items ðŸ‘Ž with that said, I emailed them the evening our order was missing items and included a pic of the receipt. That was on 10/29. Today I finally got a response that said because THEY took too long to respond they could only offer a $5 credit. Very poor customer service!!!

The app isn't the issue it's the service itself. They need to update their system to what DD uses or something similar. They are so slow it takes 2 hrs to get an order from a place that's 10 minutes away. Yeah I can get it myself but not the point. I'm not always able to get out and I'm willing to pay for it to be delivered to me and I actually tip well. Drivers get lost or take weird ways to get to my house and it takes them longer. Just annoying. They don't care which is why I'm cancelling.

I keep getting an error page when I click "help" or "extra tip". I had a fantastic, kind driver, and I wanted to toss him an extra $5, and I can't. Deleted the app, reinstalled, force stopped, cleared cache, tried on wifi, tried on cellular. I've got a Galaxy S25 Ultra, and Amazon only makes eleven zillion dollars a day, so I'm thinking a working app shouldn't be too high an expectation, but here we are. I took a screen recording, can a dev reach out? I'm mad at Bezos, not you.

If you really want food for the same prices, just use Doordash. It offers more variety and you can get deliveries from other stores which have been extremely helpful in the past. You can always just have food ordered directly from some restaurants. I only tried it because I had Amazon Prime for a while, but it gets 1 star for having to use support to delete the account. You are supposed to be able to under "manage account" although the servers are constantly down.

Routinely late deliveries. Like, every single time, even though I always tip generously and pay extra for priority delivery. There is simply no way to get your order on time regardless of what you do. You cannot cancel a late delivery, and you will not get a refund (outside of the priority fee), even if your order arrives two hours later than expected. All around horrible experience and I wouldn't touch this app with a ten foot pole if it weren't for the free subscription from Amazon Prime.

The app itself is fine. The prices are comparable to DoorDash but in my area there are no drivers. My order is delayed constantly. When I realize my order is going to be an hour plus late and attempt to cancel, the customer service will only ever offer a discount and refuse to cancel the order. Only used it because of Amazon Prime giving free plus but it isn't worth it even at free.

Tried multiple times to order using GrubHub and I've never successfully received my food. I always get confirmations saying everything is on track, but right around the time I should be getting my meal I'll get a message that "something" went wrong and I'll be refunded. I appreciate that my money isn't lost, but each time it leaves me scrambling to find something else to eat last minute. Very frustrating experience, do not recommend.

I ordered a meal through the app. It took almost three hours to arrive, was cold, and when I tried to cancel the order I was told that I couldn't as I had been refunded too many times previously for other issues with orders I'd had in the past. They gave me a 5 dollar discount on a future order as if that somehow would fix things. Never using them again. I've had issues with Doordash but never like this.

honestly one of the more frustrating user interfaces, does not keep your cart when exiting out of the app at anytime, applying any kind of a promo and it staying on through checkout is a miracle in itself. having me redo my whole order 3 different times to the point I could not even use my first time order/user promo code at all saying only available for first time users!! in which I am one! if customer service is any better than those who've developed this app thus far then please reach out!

Annoying glitches. My order was canceled because of problem at restaurant. OK, I understand. But I can't dismiss notification after reading. It sits taking space at bottom of app screen. Closed app, cleared cache, restarted, still there. I'VE SEEN IT. Clicked Help to find out how to dismiss, get message "We're unable to connect. There may be a problem with your internet connection". Every other part of this app is connecting to internet. So help is broken and error message is wrong. Ugh.

The past few times I've tried to order food there has been no delivery! "Delivery is Paused" "Pickup only". Why would anyone even USE the app for pickup? Just call the restaurant, tell them you want to place a pickup order, why pay a middleman? DELIVERY is what this app is supposed to provide and they fail EVERY TIME. It has been so long since I have been able to get food from here that they are offering me a welcome back coupon... that is useless since they can't deliver my order!

I preordered food to come within a specific time frame and it came almost an hour late. I had preordered it almost 4 hours in advance because I wanted to ensure it would come on time, then when I tried to report in the app that it was well past when it was supposed to be here, they said I had too many complaints or refunds (which is bs because I only previously made one or two orders and didn't file any complaints either time) and that I had to file an appeal which then wouldn't load.

The user interface is nice but, too many times my items go missing. I have to constantly go through the refund process. One time is normal but, 4 to 5 times is a bit too excessive for a delivery app. It's slightly cheaper to use than the competition but, what's the point if the performance is poor.

App is ok. Took a while to figure out how to contact customer support and return to them after having to check something else. Main issue is with their process. I placed an order with a chicken joint around 1.5 miles from me at around 8:30pm. It got delivered at 10:42pm! It was delayed 3x! No explanation given. It looked like the driver was going around in circles. Customer service wasn't much help. This experience reminded me why I don't use GrubHub.

it is going on 2 hours. my order has not been picked up nor has it been assigned and I have a supervisor telling me they refuse to cancel my order or refund me. customer service is horrible. it's like talking to a wall. it's an automatic response always. I have been told several times I am getting credits because my order was late. my credits have not shown up. I can't get an update on any of those let alone getting my order canceled. just all around horrible experience. I'm done using this app

I recently had an order where it wasn't delivered, and grubhub gave me credits for it, which is fine, but every time I try to check out it says their is an error or that the payment method is wrong, I have tried so many times, tried clearing the app, logging out and logging back it and nothing is fixing it. I'm really getting over it. I hope that I can use it soon so I dont just lose my money.

Refusal to refund order never delivered. cancelled membership after long time use. new number swap delivery system is confusing and has strangers literally waiting at my doorstep for me even when I request no contact delivery. customer service is a nightmare to navigate, wasting time just to be told "your account is not eligible for a refund" and "you can talk to someone above me but they can't refund you either. "

I paid $20 to get food delivered in a timely manner. Total was over $50, and I NEVER got it. I cancelled the order after an HOUR watching the driver drop off other orders instead of picking up mine, which had been sitting there close to an hour at that point... Worst delivery app I've experienced (this was my first time trying GrubHub!). Just stick to the much more well known apps.

Used to be a great idea and a way to try new foods. Unfortunately now most food is delivered cold because the drivers are doubling up on deliveries causing them to miss delivery times. Even paying for the priority delivery doesn't seem to help and most of the time it has to be credited back. I had to reduce my review again due to poor security of GrubHub. My account was broken into twice in 1 weekend even after resetting the password multiple times. if you like your money, I recommend avoiding!

I've been using this app for years, but I'm done with it. Stuff happens when you order food. In person, it's easy to address. However, when you're ordering online, it's different. If you're okay with accepting mistakes with your food this is the app to use. GH won't do anything when your order has an issue. Chat is the worst on the Internet. Call the restraunt and order with them directly in the first place. It'll save on fees and the headache of trying to use this awful app.

your app is hot garbage. it has wild inaccuracies. it costs about 200% more than purchasing in store. it states an approximate delivery time and is off by almost 100%. let me code it for you and I can fix this dumpster fire of an app. there are machine learning models that can more accurately predict times. if I place an order, the price, time, and quality are all considerations. when you mislead people to try to coerce them into making a purchase, it's just a trash business model

First time using this app, and they didn't disappoint! I ordered from one restaurant that accepted my order, then claimed they were no longer making breakfast orders. Grubhub refunded my money, and because it takes 3-5 days, they also included a $15 credit so that I could place another order somewhere else. That's what you call great customer service!!!

the app is ok and is cheaper than door dash but it shows in customer service.. ever order is missing something or not picked up ever and you have to fight to get a refund when they didn't have anyone pick up my order. and all they can do is give you a $5 credit... and it's a fight to get past the AI to actually talk to a person. GrubHub you need to do better and actually deliver what we order and actually have ppl to fix problems and not just offer $5 that doesn't do much of anything

They bundled 3 deliveries with mine, the order took 1 hour which usually takes 20 minutes on other apps. The driver dumped my food out on the street and left, did not read a single delivery instruction. They offered me $5 credit for this "wonderful" experience. I'm deleting the app. This was the third time in the same week that they messed up my food delivery.

Drivers steal food and don't deliver properly even with Tips and instructions are given. Grubhub handles it by ordering the same food again for you free of charge excep that you have to wait again another 30-40 minutes which is frustrating. Let's not forget that the items are more expensive than what they are at the restaurant and they charge you extra fees which are sometimes ridiculous. Edit 10/26/25: it is even worse now. only thing keeping this app alive is amazon.

This is more of a review of the service than the app, which is fine, although probably a little too cluttered for its own good. In the Orlando area, GrubHub does not have the driver support it needs. As a result, the food is waiting to be picked up, getting cold and soggy. try one of the other food delivery apps for quicker service.

Constantly late or just straight up fails for delivery. Horrible customer service, no longer worth the money for whatever "convenience" they ever managed to offer. Save on all the fees and the fact you'll likely not get your order delivered anyway, and just call it in and go pick it up. Better for everyone. Except grubhub I suppose.

I'm stuck at the hospital with my wife looking for food delivery so I don't have to leave her side, but every restaurant I've found has "Delivery paused due to high demand". I understand this happens through no fault of grubhub, but I don't understand why restaurants that are not currently delivering still show up on the delivery search. It's possible that one restaurant may not have deliveries paused, but I'm not wasting my time clicking through all the options in hopes of finding one

GrubHub+ offers impossible to redeem because the restaurant doesn't offer the item the offer is for. Example: Popeye's offer for a free chicken sandwich with $15 order... except the restaurant has delisted that item,.making it impossible to order. There are also other bugs, such as items with mandatory options that aren't selctable (e.g. pick 6 sauces but only 4 options with choice to select the same sauce twice, so you can't order the item) and there's no reporting mechanism for these issues.

Can't apply two credits to an order. I tried everything to place an order with both my credits applied (1 was a refund for order not delivered, and other was extra 5.00 credit). I chatted w agent, cleared cache, cookies, reinstalled app, changed pmt source etc and nothing worked. When I clicked button to place order it did nothing or I got a pop-up error saying encountered trouble. The only way I got it to work was to remove one of the applied credits. Then it processed. Fix this bug.

I've been a longtime user of this app & never complain until today. I ordered food a whole hour before a restaurant closed & the driver didn't make it until after the restuarant closed & my order was cancelled. I think it is highly unprofessional & inefficient that you would let this happen. Please get your drivers to the place on time to pick up food. I'm considering uninstalling & recommending friends to never use this app because of the potential for this to happen to them too.

App is OK, but no customer service. orders are constantly missing items, and their only response is to refund. If four people order food, and only three meals show up, do you want a refund, or the food you ordered? What do you tell the person whose food didn't show? I realize that's a large burden on them, but maybe that burden boosts the quality control so it doesn't keep happening. Somewhere around 1/3 of my orders are missing items. $10 is my MINIMUM tip, so I don't think think that's it.

In the past few months, it seems that the quality of customer service AND drivers has declined. In my past several orders, I have had missing items, and it seems to be due to mistakes made by drivers, in that they aren't checking the receipt to make sure they have collected all the items in my order. Additionally, though I have added clear instructions, drivers frequently misplace my orders or provide photos that don't show an obvious location, meaning I have to search my entire building.

Better than DoorDash in price. Deliveries tend to be a bit slower, but I'm not usually in such a hurry. It seems to give drivers more opportunities to deliver multiple orders at once which is good for making this cheaper and more sustainable. However, they have less options overall, but sometimes options that DoorDash doesn't have. Especially if you already have Amazon Prime (which includes Grubhub+), there's no point in not keeping this if you ever order food delivery. The app is clean to use.

Avoid this app!! Unlike their competitors, they won't show you exactly how many minutes away your driver is and when they give you "credit" for the inconvenience, you can't actually use the credit, especially with a gift card. You have to use the credit with additional money, not money you've already given them(gift cards). scammers, plain and simple.

The app functions fine. It's Grubhub itself that is just terrible. I started using it because it was free with Prime, but it's not worth it. So many fees added on that even with "free delivery" it's more expensive than DD. I stopped using it for a while because every time I placed an order, it was delayed by 30 min or more. EVERY TIME. Tried to give it another chance today, and SHOCKER, my order is delayed. Unistalling after this order gets here, if it ever does.

Almost every order is missing something. Normally the drink. You get a refund but nit enough to cover the fees they charged you. Lets you rate the food not the driver, which would probably help with improving the drivers service. On top of that it doesn't pick the closest restaurant so I am waiting an hour plus for food. Customer service is okay but if there are multiple issues with your order you only can pick one and have to swallow the others.

they can't even get a delivery driver assigned to me for over an hour (happens a quarter of the time). There has been plenty of times where I could of went and got my food and come back 2 or 3 times in the time it took to get delivered. They upcharge each price on the menu and then act like they're not charging you extra fees because you have prime. They ask you to rate your experience but they only have a rating system for the driver and restaurant but it's usually the app that sucks.

this app is trash. I accidentally placed an order while trying to switch my payment method and tried to cancel the order 4 times, but it would not let me because someone accepted the order. if your food has not been picked up, you should be able to cancel your order. I'm extremely disappointed in the GrubHub app. I can not recommend this service when you can't even cancel an accidental order even tho there seems to be options for it. they are there but can't be used. very sus.

I created an order but when I tried to check out, the app said the restaurant was closed. I called the restaurant and they said they were open & have had deliveries picked up throughout the day. I tried to delete that order to order from a different restaurant but it kept giving me an error. I ended up having to delete the app & reinstall it. App is useless if you can't order!!

New company policies break core functionality without telling you. Their customer service can't do anything except send you template emails (with one exception). If you want to delete your account, the link through the app is "broken" and has been for multiple years. You have to contact customer support to do so (the one exception)

Can't empty cart if I leave an order for a day because I changed my mind. Get an error when I try to delete. Contacted support and nothing was resolved. Was told it's empty on their side so they don't see any issue. I figured out that I have to uninstall and reinstall the app to empty the cart. Deleting items from the cart should not result in an error just because I waited to delete the item. And support is unhelpful and dismissive.

app is clunky and not intuitive. it created a new account when trying to link Amazon now I have to use a new account because it won't allow me to unlink it. trouble logging in multiple times tusing the correct login information. try logging in through Facebook try logging in through Amazon constant issues just a loop back to log in every time. terrible app. now I'm trying to manage 2 accounts and it's forcing me into the app every time I go to the web address.

Talk about INFLATED prices! Plus the egregious service (plus delivery) fees. The more you order, the higher the fees. They wanted to charge me over $10 for the service fee for 2 sandwiches with sides, plus one dessert. Once I removed the dessert, the service fee dropped to roughly $6. This app and the businesses are unbelievable. Being an Amazon Prime member made no difference with this specific business.

Some of the worst customer service I have ever seen. I had a $50 order that was over 50 minutes late and extremely cold, and customer service wanted to provide $5 discount on a future order. What kind of service expects their mistakes to earn them more money in the future at a $5 discount. Would never recommend using this service to anyone.

Terrible UX. Status of order currently in progress isn't shown in the app. Pressing the "Orders" button only shows past orders, and clicking the "Track your order" button in the email confirmation just goes to the app home screen where I can search for restaurants. Why would I place another order when I'm already waiting for one? If my order isn't delivered yet, the status of it should be the first thing I see when I open the app. Instead it's nowhere to be found. Awful experience. Try harder.

I live 1 mile away from a local bagel place. sometimes it used to be fun to sleep in and order through this app. Free delivery fee depending on where you live. again, a mile away. and they want to charge us suddenly. unfair. I'll save myself the money and just drive there myself. screw these greedy corporate mongerals. I have uninstalled and won't be ever using them again until they change it and make delivery fees fair.

App interface is nice. The fact that I left a tip BEFORE getting service, only to then get cra service and half my order missing (2 items, good job) and be unable to remind that tip (which should be for GOOD service). Now I'm stuck at work with half my order, no drink, and no utensils. I wish I could say this was a rare occurrence, but then I'd be lying. Between Grub hub and Door Dash as my options for food delivery, I'd rather walk. at least then, I know the order will be all there.... 0/5

title: Welltory: Heart Rate Monitor
description: Welltory is your personalized health tracker app. Get more insights about your heart health with a smart heart rate monitor app: check heart rate, pulse and blood pressure, track health and stress. Already loved by 16 million users, quoted by Johns Hopkins University, Harvard Medical School, TechCrunch, Product Hunt, Lifehacker and others. Our symptom tracker analyzes heart rate variability (hrv) â€” a heart health marker backed by over 20,000 studies on PubMed â€” to assess your heart health and overall wellness. Studies show that our hrv measurement method is as accurate as ECGs (EKGs) and heart rate monitors. By simply measuring your hrv using your smartphone camera or watch, you can get personalized insights about your heart and health. Sync 1,000+ supported apps & gadgets, from Garmin to Reddit, to track your activity, sleep, productivity, nutrition, meditations, and more. Record your bp data and use our blood pressure checker analytics. Our AI will scan your data and track your symptoms for insights daily and gradually guide you to feel happier and healthier. All-in-one Health App â€“ See how everything you do impacts your overall health, energy and stress levels, ability to focus, and mood â€“ Get personalized research reports, based on HRV measurements, that show what impacts your health the most â€“ Get notified about health trends Blood pressure monitor Is it possible to measure blood pressure through a phone camera? No, but weâ€™ll help you understand what your blood pressure numbers mean if you sync your blood pressure monitor or manually add blood pressure data. Plus, you can export your bp readings and share them with your doctor. More health data â€“ more accurate health monitor â€“ Use 1,000+ data sources for daily health and lifestyle insights â€“ Sync with FitBit, Samsung, Garmin, MiFit, Polar, Mi Band, Oura, Withings and other wearables for more heart health data Stress Tracker â€“ Keep track of your stress levels 24/7 to live in tune with your body â€“ Get stress relief guidance and recommendations on how to cope with stress, panic attacks, and insomnia Bedtime stories & calming sounds to help you sleep â€“ Explore an endless library of beautiful sleep stories and relaxing music, uniquely tailored to your heartbeat â€“ Experience calm sounds for anxiety and serene narratives that gently encourage you to go to bed, turning your sleep ritual into a journey of relaxation Sleep Flow is not just a bunch of random calming sounds for sleep. It's designed to relax your mind and improve your sleep quality. Every word and sound of it is backed by the science of sleep. Wear OS watch app Our Wear OS app allows you to set a tile on your watch for easy access to your latest measurements and includes complications that enable you to quickly start a new measurement directly from the watch surface. The Welltory Wear OS app is compatible with Samsung Galaxy Watch4, Galaxy Watch4 Classic, Galaxy Watch5, and Galaxy Watch5 Pro, but it is not compatible with other Wear OS devices. NOTE Heart rate monitor may cause hot LED flash. Try keeping your finger 1-2 mm away from the flashlight or lay just a tip of the finger on the flash or alternatively cover the flash with one half of the fingertip. Welltory can only measure your HRV and detect heartbeats. We cannot measure blood pressure and any other vital signs through the phone camera. Also the app is not a substitute for ekg interpretation. Always consult your doctor if you feel physically unwell.
descriptionHTML:
Welltory is your personalized health tracker app. Get more insights about your heart health with a smart heart rate monitor app: check heart rate, pulse and blood pressure, track health and stress. Already loved by 16 million users, quoted by Johns Hopkins University, Harvard Medical School, TechCrunch, Product Hunt, Lifehacker and others.

Our symptom tracker analyzes heart rate variability (hrv) â€” a heart health marker backed by over 20,000 studies on PubMed â€” to assess your heart health and overall wellness.

Studies show that our hrv measurement method is as accurate as ECGs (EKGs) and heart rate monitors. By simply measuring your hrv using your smartphone camera or watch, you can get personalized insights about your heart and health. Sync 1,000+ supported apps & gadgets, from Garmin to Reddit, to track your activity, sleep, productivity, nutrition, meditations, and more. Record your bp data and use our blood pressure checker analytics. Our AI will scan your data and track your symptoms for insights daily and gradually guide you to feel happier and healthier.

All-in-one Health App

â€“ See how everything you do impacts your overall health, energy and stress levels, ability to focus, and mood
â€“ Get personalized research reports, based on HRV measurements, that show what impacts your health the most
â€“ Get notified about health trends

Blood pressure monitor

Is it possible to measure blood pressure through a phone camera? No, but weâ€™ll help you understand what your blood pressure numbers mean if you sync your blood pressure monitor or manually add blood pressure data. Plus, you can export your bp readings and share them with your doctor.

More health data â€“ more accurate health monitor

â€“ Use 1,000+ data sources for daily health and lifestyle insights
â€“ Sync with FitBit, Samsung, Garmin, MiFit, Polar, Mi Band, Oura, Withings and other wearables for more heart health data

Stress Tracker

â€“ Keep track of your stress levels 24/7 to live in tune with your body
â€“ Get stress relief guidance and recommendations on how to cope with stress, panic attacks, and insomnia

Bedtime stories & calming sounds to help you sleep

â€“ Explore an endless library of beautiful sleep stories and relaxing music, uniquely tailored to your heartbeat
â€“ Experience calm sounds for anxiety and serene narratives that gently encourage you to go to bed, turning your sleep ritual into a journey of relaxation

Sleep Flow is not just a bunch of random calming sounds for sleep. It's designed to relax your mind and improve your sleep quality. Every word and sound of it is backed by the science of sleep.

Wear OS watch app

Our Wear OS app allows you to set a tile on your watch for easy access to your latest measurements and includes complications that enable you to quickly start a new measurement directly from the watch surface.

The Welltory Wear OS app is compatible with Samsung Galaxy Watch4, Galaxy Watch4 Classic, Galaxy Watch5, and Galaxy Watch5 Pro, but it is not compatible with other Wear OS devices.

NOTE
Heart rate monitor may cause hot LED flash. Try keeping your finger 1-2 mm away from the flashlight or lay just a tip of the finger on the flash or alternatively cover the flash with one half of the fingertip.
Welltory can only measure your HRV and detect heartbeats. We cannot measure blood pressure and any other vital signs through the phone camera. Also the app is not a substitute for ekg interpretation. Always consult your doctor if you feel physically unwell.
summary: Monitor health with the stress test and pulse checker in the heart rate app.
developer: Welltory: heart-rate monitor & blood pressure log

scraped_reviews.content: I want to like this app. I love the interface and the charts it can give you - however, it will NEVER complete a reading! The progress circle gets all the way to the end and then says it lost connection. I have yet to get one single reading. I don't understand how it'll read all the way to the end then say it's not connected. I literally have my phone & watch beside each other. If this issue and actually get something to log, I'll change my rating because I think it has great potential
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. We're sorry to hear about the trouble with completing readings. To improve accuracy, ensure your Samsung Watch fits snugly, sensors are clean, and you're still during measurements. If the issue persists, please send us a bug report via Menu â†’ Report a problem â†’ Send, so we can assist further.

scraped_reviews.content: pretty good! the Sleep tracking isn't super great. I find my Samsung Health and Oura sleep tracking to be more in line with my actual sleep. I would also like to see the ability to use multiple fitness trackers to improve activity tracking. I also find the main page to be a bit cluttered. You can customize it some, but not to the degree I would like. But overall it's good. The HVR stuff is really cool and some of the other insights and capabilities are nice as well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your thoughtful review. We'll share your feedback about multiple trackers and customization with the team. For a cleaner main page, try filtering your feed. We're glad you enjoy the HRV insights ðŸ™‚

scraped_reviews.content: The only thing I don't like in this app is that the information displayed during the measurement is flipping so fast that no matter how fast reader you're, you still can't read a full statement, that makes it more stressful than informative which probably increases the stress during the measurement and probably adding an error to the metrics. once this is taken care of, I will give it 5 stars. Everything else is great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your thoughtful review. We hear you about the fast-flipping information during measurements. While itâ€™s designed to provide quick insights, we understand it might feel overwhelming. We'll share your feedback with our team. We're glad you enjoy the rest of the app and appreciate your support ðŸ™‚

scraped_reviews.content: I am amazed as to how accurate this app is. I was feeling tired and opened it up and it said my energy was low. It is probably my favorite health app so far! My only qualm at the moment is that I cannot figure out how to get the energy calendar with the color dots back like it showed in signing up. But that's small potatoes compared to how cool the app really is!
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your wonderful review and kind words ðŸ¥° We're thrilled to hear how much you're enjoying the app and finding it accurate. Regarding the energy calendar, it might not be available in your current version. If you'd like, you can explore the web Dashboard for more insights: https://app.welltory.com/dashboard.

scraped_reviews.content: free trial too limited in scope to evaluate the product before purchasing. Fitbit discontinued health pdf digital reports , looking for alternatives but this is discouraging . moving on to the next search....some = few in this case and is not good enough "We have a 3-day free trial demonstrating some of the Welltory Premium features. It starts automatically when you sign up for Welltory."
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for sharing your thoughts. We hear you about the trial scope. The 3-day free trial offers a glimpse of Premium features, but the free version still provides HRV measurements to monitor your body state. If you're exploring alternatives to Fitbit reports, Welltory might still be worth a try.

scraped_reviews.content: inconsistent. doesn't always pull data from other apps (sleep results especially). data is often incorrect, i.e. citing current data as baseline. I have the premium and cannot figure out how to cancel.edited to add, I've checked all connections. it works properly 90% of the time which leads me to believe it's not a set up issue. If you're ok with 90%accuracy you'll probably be happy with this app. for sleep the app literally takes my current sleep time and calls it the baseline. every single day
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. For data issues, please check syncing and permissions in your source apps. Regarding cancellation, you can manage your subscription via this Help article: https://help.welltory.com/articles/3376353-. If needed, contact us via Menu â†’ Report a problem â†’ Send, and we'll assist you.

scraped_reviews.content: Great tracking, but borderline fear-mongering to sell subscriptions. Great for tracking BP, but beware the scare tactics. App often flags normal readings as â€œalarmingâ€ to push premium features. If you have low diastolic or high pulse pressure, even if you feel fine, itâ€™ll act like itâ€™s a crisis. Can cause anxiety if you donâ€™t know better. Use it to log data, but trust your doctor â€” not red icons and panic alerts.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Thank you for your feedback. We hear your concerns and want to clarify that Welltory is not a medical app and cannot replace a doctorâ€™s advice. Our alerts aim to highlight trends for awareness, not to diagnose. For BP tracking, you can log data manually or automatically. Learn more here: https://help.welltory.com/articles/3878866-.

scraped_reviews.content: I was kind of leery of this app when I started seeing the same comments, like the same kind of pep talks the same stress levels and duplicate lectures. now it's time to cancel and guess what there's no way to do it, and no where to do it so don't waste your money unless you like apps that won't let you cancel and feed you BS everyday. Half the time it wouldn't even tell me what was going on like it was supposed to.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, we're sorry to hear about your experience. To cancel your subscription, please follow this guide: https://help.welltory.com/articles/3376353-. If you're facing issues, contact us via the app: Menu â†’ Report a problem â†’ Send. Weâ€™ll be happy to help sort this out and improve your experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I've used this app for a year, and I find it to be inconsistent. It will say my deep sleep for the night was 24 minutes, and in a graph right below that it will say my deep sleep was 1 hour and 28 minutes. Huh? The multitude of data points and charts are overwhelming with no clear action for me to take to improve them. It rarely matches how I feel. scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Austin!Sometimes,back-to-back measurements can show different results.The reason can be either a change in your emotional/physical state or measurement accuracy.It doesn't mean something's wrong with the app,or the measure is inaccurate.HRV is highly sensitive to even the slightest changes,incl.changes happening inside your body and ext.factors.

title: Step Tracker - Pedometer

descriptionHTML:
The most accurate & simple step tracker auto tracks your daily steps, burned calories, walking distance, duration, pace, health data, etc., and display them in intuitive graphs for easy checking.

Power Saving Pedometer
Step counter counts your daily steps with the built-in sensor, which greatly saves battery. It records steps accurately even when the screen is locked, whether your phone is in your hand, your pocket, your bag, or your armband.

Real-time Map Tracker
In GPS tracking mode, step counter tracks your fitness activity in detail (distance, pace, time, calories), and records your routes on the map with GPS in real-time. But if you donâ€™t choose GPS tracking, it will count steps with built-in sensor to save battery.

100% Free & 100% Private
No locked features. No login required. You can freely use all features without login.

Easy to Use Step Counter
It auto records your steps. Pause, resume steps counting, reset steps to count from 0 if you want. Once you pause it, background data refreshing will stop. You will get your daily steps report on time, you can also check your real-time steps in the notification bar.

Report Graph
Your walking data will be displayed in clear graphs. You can easily check your daily, weekly and monthly walking statistics. Support for syncing data with Google Fit.

Targets and Achievements
Set daily steps goal. Continuously achieve your goal will keep you motivated. You can also set targets for your fitness activity (distance, calories, duration, etc.).

Fashion & Simple Design
Designed and developed by our Google Play Best of 2018 winning team, its clean, simple, and fashion design brings excellent user experience.

Colorful Themes
More themes coming soon. Select your favorite theme for the step tracker and enjoy the step counting.

Health Tracker App
Health tracker app records your health data (weight trends, sleep conditions, water intake details, diet, etc.) and helps you maintain a healthy lifestyle. Stay active, lose weight and keep fit with activity & health tracker.

More features coming soon, such as sync data with Fitbit, Samsung Health, MyFitnessPal...

Important Notes

* To ensure accurate step counting, make sure the information you entered on the settings page is correct.
* You can adjust the sensitivity level of the step tracker for more accurate step counting.
* Some devices may stop counting when the screen is locked due to their power saving processing.
* Devices with older version canâ€™t count steps with locked screen.

Steps tracker
Want a steps tracker to track your daily steps? This accurate steps tracker can help you.

Steps counter
Steps counter helps track your daily steps, burned calories, and weight loss progress. Lose weight with steps counter.

Steps counting app
This steps counting app is very easy to use. Open it and start to walk, steps counting app automatically records your steps.â€¨

Pedometer step counter
A simple pedometer step counter auto tracks your steps. Walk with pedometer step counter, keep fit and get in better shape.

Walking app
Need a pedometer for walking to track your steps? This walking app is your best choice.â€¨

Walking distance tracker
This walking distance tracker tracks your steps and calculates distance accurately. It's a full-featured walking distance tracker. It is also good for your health.
summary: Daily step tracker, free pedometer & map tracker to count steps and calories.

scraped_reviews.content: Love it! I had no need of making an in app purchase. Perfectly serves my purpose as is. Other than a single ad that can be stopped as soon as it starts. No intrusive ads during your trek. Only one bad thing I noticed was that that the display turns off while biking and I prefer that it stayed on so I can know where I am during my trek and not get lost.

Nice app. I like it. I wanted it just for free walking. I like how it keeps track of the total time of your walk (with the ability to pause and resume) distance shown on a map with your actual movement, counts your steps and how many calories you burned. It does usually have you watch through medium to long length ads, which are very annoying.

I've been loving this app. It's been about 8 months I havnt been able to walk. I never got rid of this app because it does track the amount you have walked, fair. Grocery stores and ect. Everyday it shows a little reminder to go walking with different positive notes. It's accurate. It's not like the others, where it count steps and all you did was move your wrist. boy, was that most irritating. I encourage all to seriously use this. It even encourages you to keep going to reach your goal 2day !

I had the app for exactly one year, 365 days before uninstalling. I used it only for tracking my steps. It counted in intervals of ten not individually, so it wasn't always accurate. It also used to be ad-free. They've begun to add ads gradually. First only when you open the app, but now more and more common to see. I tolerated the app for a year, but have uninstalled because of these two reasons. There are better free step trackers out there. :)
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Cameron, sorry for the inconvenience. Our app counts steps by reading the data returned by the sensor in your phone. Due to the limitations of cell phone sensors, some devices may have a delay in returning steps. We will keep improving the algorithm. We need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: App is PERFECT! I don't know if it can tell the difference between running and walking as I'm sure running would burn more calories per step but it's a great app, unless......unless you get a new phone. I had so many achievements and when I got a new phone NONE of the info transferred over. Most of the achievements I had the highest possible one done. It said I walked more than 99.9% of all users and I had to lose it all. That's why I only gave 3 stars. Otherwise it would be 5 stars easy!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry for the trouble, Eric.
We recommend that you back up your current steps before uninstalling the app on your old phone by clicking "Profile--Backup & Restore â€˜â€™. After installing on your new phone, you can click the same button to resume your steps.

scraped_reviews.content: I have used this app for about 3 years and have loved it. Earlier this year, my walking routes suddenly became around 1/2 mile longer. If distances are calculated using GPS, why the change? I have submitted several crash reports to no avail. The map option is helpful when walking an unfamiliar route, but other than that, this app is no longer useful to me. Thanks for the feedback. The precise location had already been selected.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Penelope. Variations in GPS receivers across different phone models, along with obstacles like buildings or trees, can impact the GPS signal and reduce accuracy. We recommend that you long press the app icon, go to the app settings, and enable precise location permission. Then, please try again in an area with a strong GPS signal.

scraped_reviews.content: You need a pedometer for indoors as GPS/location services don't track well, if at all. This app does a great job and it's quite easy to use. Check the length of your stride and if it's different than what's typical for your height, which is set automatically, change it to manual and enter the correct value. I've found the step and distance count to be very accurate.

I love this app. I am pretty much homebound since long before Covid, but I like trying to increase my steps slowly and surely. I can look at them and decide whether to increase my steps or maintain them for the time being. I had to learn how to walk again after an accident. This keeps me moving. If I can build up the strength I may be able to avoid a surgerie(s).

This is a fairly okay app if you just want to get a general idea of how much activity you're getting on a daily basis and, seeing this is a free app, the price is right for that. If you're in need of something with a little more accuracy, however, I'd recommend looking for a device that's designed with this service in mind --- which, sadly, means spending money. You'll discover with Step Tracker that your walk calculations can be off anywhere from between 200 to 2000 steps on any given day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Nick, sorry for the inconvenience. We fully understand your feelings.
This app uses the built-in sensor in the phone to count steps, but the sensor of different devices differs.
We will continue to work hard to improve the algorithm. Hope to bring you a better experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Very good for tracking miles walked. I use it at work and play...it's easy to use and not a bother. It let's me know when I have reached a goal walking and sets new goals , for me great app............ the review is kinda long wanting 500 words to explain how good it is they need to cut it back like 200 words. Or they can just let you put words in to get past this and go on to ratings and back to your phone. I hope they correct it and make it simpler for us. I tried to think of everything bye

Yes it has ads, but I don't find them overly invasive. It does what it's supposed to do. It acts as a passive step counter, & has a training mode where you can log your jaunts. The accuracy of the miles per minute seems to improve as you go along. Also, this app does tell you it's overall accuracy depends on phone hardware. And don't run the app and battery saver at the same time. It really goes screwy.

I love the app and have been using it for almost a year without a problem but had my phone stolen and reloaded the app. I can't get it to backup/restore my old info however. It goes kind of dim and does nothing else. I have to hit back and it goes back but I can't get it to restore my information... That's sucks. Update: nevermind. It just took a long time for Google to come up. Was able to get it restored. Gave it 5 stars.

I've had this app for several years and been very satisfied until recently. I don't mind the pop up ads but in the last few months those have become longer ads that you can't dismiss for 30 seconds or longer. When I'm just opening the app to quickly check a stat, this is a huge turn off. If there's not an ad-free purchase option, I'll soon be looking for a different app. No complaints otherwise...it works really well.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Jeshua, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interrupts to you. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "Profile" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: This app works very well as a pedometer and it has a lot of nice features, so I chose to upgrade to the paid version. Every single time I use it, it reverts to the ad-supported version, and I have to delete and reinstall to remove the ads. The developers never respond to support requests. So, use the app, but do not bother to pay for it, unless you like seeing full screen ads that you can't skip, and you like reinstalling apps every day.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi L, sorry for your inconvenience again. Did you log in with multiple accounts? The default account at the moment may not be the one you used to pay for. Please check.

scraped_reviews.content: You know, this app is really good, but the ads at the end drive me nuts. I am considering removing the app due to this. I once saw an option to pay to have the ads removed but can't find it again. I simply didn't have my credit card handy at the time. Also, I do not need the 1/2 way announcement, it is annoying. Same for the end of target distance. Please, allow us to kill these. Other announcements are disabled. I was hoping to be able to pay for ad removal on this site.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Chris, sorry for the inconvenience.
You can remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "Profile" page.
You can also turn off the training sound in the training settings, but we do not support turning off the celebration sound at this time. We will continue to improve our app. Thanks for your support.

scraped_reviews.content: There are too many ads. UPDATE FOR YOUR QUICK RESPONSE AND MAKING IT A 5 STAR. Thanks for the quuck response. Maybe move ads to another location on the screen like the top. At the bottom, the ads interfere with the Android controls on the bottom of the screen. Also, I did purchase the app, so hopefully, there are no more ads.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Quay, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interrupts to you. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "Profile" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: Very easy to use. The GPS is very accurate. I've been using this app for about a year now and I love it. I have tried a couple of other free step tracking/pedometer apps and this one is the best IMO. It not only keeps count of steps but shows a map of the route taken, how many calories burned and tells you how many minutes per mile walked all on the same page. It has inspired me to increase my walks from .5 miles to 4 miles +. I am 66 years young and this has done wonders for my health.

I really like the app. I like that it tells me my stats while walking. It's easy to use and I like the GPS portion. The only thing I'm finding is that I do full mile markers, so yesterday I did 3 at lunch then 6 after work for a total of 9 miles. Today when I looked at my total for yesterday it says 8.26. I don't get the discrepancy, which part is off? Is gps off or the record keeping? It bugs me not having an accurate log. But, other than that it's simple and at least keeps me motivated.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Emily, we are really sorry for the problem you encountered. 
Could you please send us a feedback email with the description of your problem via â€œProfile--Feedback"? This will help us a lot to locate and fix the bug.
Looking forward to your reply.
Best regards,
Leap Fitness Group

scraped_reviews.content: I used to love this app, but the ads have become very obtrusive the last few months, so I'll be switching to another pedometer app. It's a shame they had to ruin the experience I undestand the need for apps on a free app, however I don't understand the need to have ads explode over the app when you open or when you try to exit. A more subtle ad makes it a lot more likely for me, at least, to look at at an ad, versus now it gives me a negative view of the product
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi James, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interrupts to you. You can also remove ads by the "Remove ads" subscription on the "Profile" page.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: This app has been great for keeping track of progress, it is encouraging with the badges, and the GPS is better than any other tracking app I've had, and I went through about six others. You also can plan for say a 1 mile walk, but at the end you still wanna keep going? It lets you know your time at 1 mile, but will keep tracking extra progress automatically. It helps to not have to start and stop constantly.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Nickolas McAnally, thanks for your feedback.
It's a great honor that you like our app. We will continue working hard to bring you a better user experience.
If you have any other suggestions, please feel free to contact us at steptrackerfeedback@gmail.com.
Best regards,
Leap Fitness Group

scraped_reviews.content: I was looking for an app to count my steps and I didn't really know what to expect from this app, you get so many that are confusing and too much trouble than their worth. I installed it and I forgot that I even had it open, then left to run some errands, and went for a walk after. I got back and to my surprise there was a notification saying I had 3,000 steps! As an extra plus, you don't need to give a bunch of personal stuff or sign up for anything!

I have tried and used several Step Tracker / Recorders and there is NO DOUBT that this one is the absolute best!! Easily 5 Stars! Greatly detailed maps, perfect accuracy, choice of recording with battery-saving Internal body movements OR your phone GPS, your choice any and every time you walk, run, bike or whatever it is you want to do! So much more available all at such a low price... just a few bucks for the purchased version!! Big Thank You to the Developers. MUCH appreciated! ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘ðŸ‘

Used this app for years without problems. But a couple annoying changes were made. First of all when I turn it on all the sudden it go to a blue screen where I had to wait while a little bar on the bottom was working. Before my screen just came up. Don't know what the use of that was for. And now they have all these ads that pop up over your information that you can't get rid of without getting out of the app and coming back. Today was worst! Everything changed to Chinese! Had to uninstall it!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Judy, sorry for the inconvenience.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
And could you please send us a feedback email with the description of the language problem you encountered via "Profile--Feedback"? This will help us a lot to locate and fix the bug. Thanks.

scraped_reviews.content: There's two issues I can't get past: 1) The app gives audio feedback. I have turned that off, yet I still get an audible countdown when the app begins, when I'm halfway to my step goal and when I reach the goal. I listen to podcasts while I walk. The audio plays over which causes me to have to rewind. 2) I often forget to end my tracking once I come back home which means the timer continues to run. You can override the number of steps, but not the time. I did pay for the full version.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hello Angela, sorry for the inconvenience.
You can turn off the training sound in the training settings, but we do not support turning off the celebration sound at the moment. We will take your issue seriously and make some improvements in future versions.

scraped_reviews.content: I'd give it a 5-star review if the GPS wasn't always inaccurate when you first turn the app on. It can really screw up your record-keeping if you're not paying attention it'll add a half a mile or whatever it is until the app catches up. You think the developers would have the GPS refresh as soon as you open the app. But nope. I've reported the issue to the developers and they ignore me.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Clint, sorry for the inconvenience.
Data points may be lost due to weak GPS signal or system permission restrictions.
It is recommended that you keep our app in the foreground and try again in an area with a strong GPS signal.
We will continue to improve our product to provide you with a better experience.

scraped_reviews.content: Very easy to use. No need to press any button. It will track every time I walk. I don't need to make regular walking in the house, in the grocery store as activities. So this app is exactly what I need. I just wish it connects to other 3rd party app so this non activity walking also can be used to calculate recovery on other 3rd party app. (Ex, Garmin Connect, Polar, MapMyFitness etc.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Nita, thanks for your feedback. It's a great honor that you like our app. We will continue working hard to bring you a better user experience. If you have any other suggestions, please feel free to contact us at steptrackerfeedback@gmail.com. Best regards, Leap Fitness Group

scraped_reviews.content: Once again, this app has failed. Most recently, it showed no movement from my starting point, and yet the final report showed that I'd moved over one mile. In reality, the route was actually less than half of that. I've had other frustrating experiences, but they're all basically the same. It doesn't always track my movement (GPS feature). It either over-counts my movement or under-counts it. When it does that it is wildly inaccurate. By comparison Google Maps accurately maps my walking route.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Steve, sorry for the inconvenience.
Data points may be lost due to weak GPS signal or system permission restrictions.
It is recommended that you keep our app in the foreground and try again in an area with a strong GPS signal.
We will continue to improve our product to provide you with a better experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app, I can deal with adds, but for some reason I get double results for each of my walks. For example it shows 2.57 miles twice under the same date. one has a map of the route, one does not. The total at the top includes both results giving false information. when I delete the one without the map, the map of the other disappears. Other than that, good App.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Andy, we are really sorry for the problem you encountered.
Could you please send us a feedback email with the description of your problem via "Profile--Feedback"? This will help us a lot to locate and fix the bug.
Looking forward to your reply.

scraped_reviews.content: This is an awesome step tracker. If your just curious how many you walk on a regular basis or if you need a little push to start moving. It really works for everyone. I really enjoy the option to compete with people near you. That definitely gives an edge for wanting to do better. And I really enjoy the drink more water reminder. That's just fun!

Just got it literally yesterday so I really can't rate honestly until I've used the app for a few days. So far, so good, though.:) Now it's almost August and I can honestly say I LOVE IT! Easy to use and never misses a step. Encourages me to "step" up my goal daily. With the help of this app, I have lost nearly 80 lbs over the past 8 months. Kudos to the ladies and gentlemen involved in the creation, design, etc of this app. Definitely a five star app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Laura, thanks for using our app. If there is anything we can do for you, please contact us. If you are satisfied with our product, please give us 5 stars, which will greatly inspire us to do better.
Have a wonderful day!ðŸŒ¹

scraped_reviews.content: I've downloaded this app several times on four different phones and two different carriers. The first time, it worked great, and I was very happy with how it worked. The second time, my history didn't transfer, so I just started from zero again. Later, the app started acting weird and gave me a lot of advertising in Russian. Since I changed carrier it hasn't worked at all. It only records a few points along a 4 mile hike, or says I walk 5 miles in 17 seconds. I'm looking for a new app.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Sorry about that.
Our developers are trying to locate your problem. We hope to solve it for you as soon as possible.
We apologize again for the inconvenience caused.
If you have any other questions, please contact us again.

scraped_reviews.content: I like the app. It's free, there are barely any ads, and the main functions - counting steps, time, keeping track over months, etc. - work well. But, and I know I'm being picky, their "London to Paris" badge distance (and a few others) isn't accurate. They have it set as "135 miles," but 'as the crow flies' it's 214 miles. Aside from that, I like it. Edit: Thanks for your response!!
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Elizabeth, thanks for using our app and giving us your suggestion. It's a great suggestion, we will take it seriously and do our best to make some improvements. If you have any other problem, please contact us via â€œMore--Feedback".
Best regardsðŸŒ¹ðŸŒ¹,
Leap Fitness Group

scraped_reviews.content: Awesome at keeping track of your movements whether walking or in the car.... It has one little lag in it... when it starts to keep track of steps you might think it's not working cause it doesn't count right away... but not long after you start it, it will catch up the steps and you'll be able to watch 1 step at a time counted by the app... It's pretty cool and basic... it's perfect what I was looking for... oh it also tracks day by day and week by week so on so you can look back at past days

The step-counting and distance has not been accurate for a month and a half. Before that time I would have given this a five-star rating. I have been using the paid version with no problem for years and love it. For the past month and a half the steps and distance walked has been totally inaccurate. I have sent around 6 crash reports. Nobody ever contacted me to rectify this problem.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, sorry for the inconvenience.
Is the issue with the distance provided during the training feature, or is it related to the daily step tracking process?

scraped_reviews.content: This app used to be amazing, but the intrusive ads seem to actually be breaking the core functionality now. I've had several instances of the app simply not recording steps, because the ads had to load in. I'm a developer for a living, and my only educated guess would be that your ad module was trying to pull in data from your ad vendor, but since I was roaming or traveling, it couldn't pull the ads, and thus the step tracking functionality failed. Edit: Fixed my horrendous spelling.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hello Brandon, sorry for the inconvenience. Our app is completely free to use, so we need to display ads for a small profit. Our developers are addressing the issue you describe, and we hope to resolve it for you as soon as possible.

scraped_reviews.content: Very glad I found this. It is easy to set up. It is based on steps and tells you when you pass 3000, 7000 etc. Each day it gives you total miles walked. It also has a timer to alert you to drink water that you can adjust to amount you want and time. You can turn off GPS, or use it for trails. You can set goals for calorie burning.

It's a nice simple app to use. I like the tracking encouragements along the way. What I don't like is that you can't turn off the pedometer. You can pause it for a while, but the app will always restart it. It's a real drain on my phone's battery. So much so that I'm now looking for alternatives - which is a real shame because I really like it for the bits I want to use. If they would just add more customisation, it would get 5 stars from me, but as it is, I'll probably have to look elsewhere.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Andrew. You can change the auto-start settings in the app-info, but please note that this may affect the app's ability to track your steps in real-time. We are continuously working on optimizing the app to reduce battery consumption. Thank you for your feedback!

scraped_reviews.content: I've been using this app for a while now and I am very happy with it. There are 5 second ads when you open the app for the first time, which you can just click on immediately after opening. Furthermore, it tracks distance walked, steps a d calories at the same time. If you want to go on a run or a walk, you can put on training mode, and set a target distance or time, and if you keep running after you pass the target, it still tracks your movement. This app is great. Five stars

works FAR better than non-gps pedometer apps (such as the blue logo with white shoe prints "pedometer" app, and "Accupedo"). Also has a MUCH cleaner layout and User Interface. very simple to use, most accurate tracking of the 3 so far, without needing to sign up for an account (under armour apps etc). At slower walking speeds the GPS tracking can go a bit loopy (zig zags etc) - but I think that's an ongoing general GPS issue, not the app. Thank you for making a simple and effective tool!

Used it for years and it worked great! Saw no ads at all. Suddenly ads area appearing and they aren't short ads, these are ads that take quite a long time to get through before you can actually get to the app. Who has time for that? I'm uninstalling and using something else. Went from good to obtrusive and a time waster.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi, sorry for the inconvenience.
We will try to adjust our ads strategy to minimize the interrupts to you.
This app is completely free for all users, so we need to display ads to earn some meager profits.
Thank you for understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: I would pay $3.00 for a stepper without ads but instead this one gives you a link that says 'click here to go ad free' which takes you to an ad that has nothing to do with the application. Additionally them putting the POP up add at the bottom so as an Adroid user you cannot DO ANYTHING w out opening an ad. PLEASE SOMEONE MAKE AN ADD FREE NO SPAMMY PEDOMETER! I want to uninstall this from phone but it has 9 months data on it but I can't take the ads anymore. What a disappointment.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi, thank you for your feedback. The Remove Ads service can be purchased within the app from the profile page, using the option in the top-right cornerâ€”please make sure to use the official channel. We show ads to generate a small revenue to keep the app running. Thank you for your understanding.

scraped_reviews.content: i like it. the water part of the app was a bit confusing. I ended up drinking a whole great value water bottle out of confusion. I dunno wat 8 is. I hope I did it right. the ads so far are not full length videos but instead are quick flyers. I appreciate that. sucks having to wait a for a whole video to end before starting your workout. thank u for making a simple user friendly app.

Ads take over your phone. I don't mind the ads at all however this app lately does not let you go beyond the advertisement. You have to close the app and open it again to to get to the content. I've used Step Tracker for a couple of years now but I'm looking to move on. Too much hassle.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Bob, thank you for your feedback. We include ads to keep the app completely free for all users. We understand that ads can be inconvenient, but once an ad finishes playing, a close button will appear, allowing you to continue using the app normally. We appreciate your patience and are working to improve the experience.

scraped_reviews.content: I love the accuracy of this app. And the best feature is that if anyone wants to maintain daily records and he can't go for a walk, then also he can maintain the record for that particular day. So I must suggest this app to all of the walkers, so that they all can know their steps, calories burnt and duration as well.

This app was very accurate until recently. The adds that are running at the lower screen stop the pedometer and doesn't catch-up the number of steps taken. And this happens with each add. so for every 50 steps, around 20 steps are lost. Very poor quality. l am switching to another app after years of usage.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi. We have conducted preliminary tests on multiple Samsung devices and did not observe the issue you mentioned. The step count difference between the app and actual steps was consistently within 5 steps, with no significant discrepancies. If you continue to experience this problem, please contact us via the in-app feedback option.

scraped_reviews.content: Something happened to this app. Doesn't track steps and now it sticks with ads you have no choice of getting out of
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Jenn, sorry for the inconvenience. It may be due to the system limitation.
To solve this issue, please click the "Fix..." option on the "Profile" page. Ads help keep the free features available, but we know they can be annoyingâ€”weâ€™re continually working to make them less intrusive.

scraped_reviews.content: Best walk tracker app with calories burnt,kms walked and steps tracking. it is very accurately and best Tracker app. I am using this app since 9 months regularly and just Today completed Level 18. ang got the crown in 9 months only. Daily,weekly monthly and yearly report seen is best facilty.

Only one ad when opened so not bad compared to others does what it supposed to set how many miles you want to walk it will inform you half through. Also can go back and look at the map and look at where you went. First time using this 5 stars

BOY am I ticked off! I was just over a thousand miles from reaching the Earth's core when the app had an update and now measures 7 steps when I know I've done 10,000 today. SO disappointing. I will probably lose all my stats even though I backed them up because at this point it's not trustworthy. anymore. I have reset and reset. I started in 2020 during the shutdown. now, worthless.
scraped_reviews.replyContent:
Hi Melanie, sorry for the inconvenience. This may be due to system limitations.
To solve this issue, please click the â€œFixâ€¦â€ option on the Profile page.
If this doesnâ€™t work, please send us a feedback email describing your issue via Profile â†’ Feedback.
Once you back up your data, it will be stored in the cloud and wonâ€™t be lost.

scraped_reviews.content: to put it simply, it's a really good app with multiple good features. For example, you can turn on notifications to drink water and completely costumise them, like if you want ml or fl oz or when to get the notifications and it's free

title: Target
description:
Get fresh deals and Target Circle offers, free Drive Up for curbside pickup, same-day delivery and easy returns, all with just a tap.

Everything you love about Target is just a tap away.

Free Drive Up: Just check out with Drive Up and weâ€™ll bring your order out to your car, weâ€™ll even load the trunk, no extra charge.

Same-Day Delivery from Target & More Local Stores: Score unlimited same-day delivery on orders over $35 with a Target Circle 360â„¢ membership, or just pay $9.99 per delivery.

Target Circle Deals: Browse hundreds of exclusive Target Circle deals, and scan barcodes as you shop so you never miss a way to save.

Just-For-You Bonuses: Earn with Target Circle rewards and save with personalized deals.Â 
Save & Pay in a Snap: At checkout, just scan your Wallet barcode to stack all your savings, Target Circle deals, gift cards and even 5% off with your Target Circleâ„¢ Card.

Plan Ahead, Shop Smarter: Build your list ahead of time, find your items in the aisles and spot whatâ€™s on sale before you even walk in.
Â 
Check Stock Before You Go: Know whatâ€™s available at your store, see top-rated finds, and read real reviews from fellow shoppers.

Shop by Category for Everything You Need: With the Target app, you can easily shop by category, whether youâ€™re looking for food & beverage, essentials & beauty, apparel & accessories or home & electronics. Just tap to find everything you need in one spot.

See It in Your Space: Place furniture and decor in your space before you decide to buy, making shopping for your space easy and fun.

Virtual Try-On: See how beauty products and accessories look on you with our virtual try-on feature, no guesswork, just confidence in your picks.

Shop Target-Owned Brands: Youâ€™ll find groceries, electronics and all the everyday essentials from Targetâ€™s own brands, like Good & Gather, up&up and Heyday.

Designer Collections Youâ€™ll Love: We team up with top designers to bring you limited-edition home decor and more.

Download the Target app and unlock savings, surprises, and a little everyday joy, every time you shop.

Everything you love about Target is just a tap away.
