summary: Not just food delivery. Shop for groceries from local supermarkets to your door.

scraped_reviews.content: Honestly, it was great at first, but now it's just gone to the gutter. I used to get a decent deal on some foods when I first started, but now the deals are just for groceries with a minimum of $75. It's even worse if you have Uber One! The taxes just get bigger, to the point where a $24 meal turns into $38, and that's not including the required tip for your driver. Thank god I unsubscribe!

The way they run this app borders on criminal fraud. I just spent 45 minutes talking to four different people, the first three of which could barely speak English, in order to have a "non-refundable alcohol restocking fee" reversed, for an order where the driver texted me from the store saying that THEY did not have THEIR OWN driver's license to be able to check out for the alcohol order they accepted. So, a restocking fee for alcohol that was never purchased, or delivered, let alone returned.

This app is so untruful in everything it says. it will tell you 0$ delivery fee for orders over 15$. My order is 17$ and its still charging me a 6$ delivery fee on top of "other" fees for 4$. I even have their subscription for no delivery fees. makes me wonder how long this has been going on without me noticing. Also they time it says it will take it not accurate at all its always double or more the time for me to actually get my food.

In the past year, they've made the support options worse by limiting the specific feedback you can leave and burying the options you need behind numerous unnecessary selections. This is clearly a move to discourage people from reporting missing or defective items. And the support is hit or miss. Sometimes they respond quickly and issue a refund. Sometimes they blame the restaurant and do nothing at all. And we're talking about completely wrong orders (different name completely).

Absolutely atrocious customer service. I've tried many times to accept this app but it's horrible. Not once have I had an order be correct, and only once have I been refunded for my issues. I've had food come with mistakes, food missing all together, etc. No way to talk to a real person to get this dealt with properly. Tried ordering again today, missing four sandwiches, the app OVERCHARGING me for items NOT on my list, time to dispute with my bank. I beg of you, don't use this app!

Biggest rip-off with the add-on fees. Also, if you get the wrong order (as happened to me, I received food I am allergic to and NOT what I ordered) they just give you $5 credit when the cost of getting the incorrect food in the first place is much more than $5 and to reorder new food cost more than $5. They clearly do not value their customers and I will be uninstalling this app.

I will not increase my rating on this app until I am given the option to permanently dismiss in-app "deal" ads I have no interest in. Garbage, I'm already paying for Uber One, stop stop STOP. Price increases on items in addition to charging additional service fees and very little of that goes to the person actually doing the work, so you have to make sure you tip a significant amount as well. Want the service fees lowered and the "delivery fees" waived? Cool sign up for Uber One for $100 a year.

I ordered some groceries with the subtotal being around $22, adding taxes and service fees it was $27 and that was fine, I had enough in my account to pay for it. I got my groceries, a great delivery driver amazing communication and was very professional. The issue is that later on in the day I received an email about my receipt and the price of my order had been upped by $6. Apparently it was additional service fees and taxes which were already added to my original order beforehand.

Bad customer service. Did not help me with my issue. Ordered food at the wrong location in a different state and canceled. wanted a refund so we can buy again at the right location but didn't get a refund. We canceled the order not even a minute after ordering after noticing the wrong location. Two days later, I tried ordering, and it would not allow me to order. I called them, and they said they would email to help me fix the problem, but they never emailed me back. My voucher expired too.

Iâ€™ve had multiple orders arrive incorrect â€” missing items, wrong deliveries, and no resolution. I always report the issues through the app, but no one ever replies. The support chat just says â€œplease wait while we respondâ€ and then nothing happens. Iâ€™ve been completely ignored. Despite being a loyal customer, I havenâ€™t received a single refund for these mistakes. Thereâ€™s no way to talk to a real person, and the app just loops you through dead ends. Itâ€™s unacceptable.

Even with a paid membership, you will still have fees that (almost) equals the cost of a full membership with another food delivery service that... I'm actually upset that I didn't cancel like I said and got suckered into a discounted renewal rate; I immediately regretted giving this company the $3 to keep an app I am growing to hate. Also, if you look closely, fees charged when you order from chain and fast food restaurants are always much, MUCH cheaper. Pretty sure that's not coincidence ðŸ§

I canceled an order 5-10 minutes after placing it. Uber Eats took the whole payment regardless and refused, several times, a refund. I asked customer service three times to refund because it was only 5-10 minutes after placing the order, and they ended the "chat" each time. I remember the days when customer service was over the phone, or you could properly dispute a case. It is absurd, no matter the store, to pay almost full price if you cancel an order within a decent time range. Absurd.

Before you order, go to the restaurant's website and look at their prices. UE tacks on extra price to every item, before charging ridiculous fees, before charging an "optional" tip and asking if you want to pay even more to avoid having your driver make multiple stops on the way. All for your $15 turned $30+ order to arrive an hour later cold. Just order takeout and go get the food. It will be faster and save you both money and energy.

Edit: Tried to use their grocery delivery today and when an item was missing they told me nothing they can do, no reason. Don't cancel an order on "your own," ask them for help, or they will give the resturant your money and not deliver it without any warning. Even after a second the reaturant is already "hard at work" and the driver is "on the way." so your money and tip are gone. I'm sure many people love just giving their money away for free, canceling your order is a "great" (scam) feature.

Very terrible app. You can no longer get someone on customer service. Everything is done through robot chat. I've had too many complications with orders lately. And all the sudden they don't allow you to cancel orders immediately if there's an issue. They charge you almost the full amount to cancel orders now. Greedy Corporation trying to take advantage of people. I will I will be deleting this app and never using it again.

If the store and driver are competent, there is usually not a problem. But if one is off, your order can be late, have missing items or be totally lost. Customer service is difficult to get a hold of. You have to use website not app. Plus agents are rude and try to rush you along. For example, Danica could give me a refund for 2 of my missing/wrong items but the 3rd missing item was beyond her scope to handle. She credited the separate order of fries but not the kids meal missing fries

They try to automate too many systems. Their help chat is unhelpful and will flag a safety issue when you just want a reciept. When you place an order, after the confirmation page - you can't view what the payment method was. You get no reciept until the delivery is completed. So.... why am i not allowed to see the confirmation page again? Sus af to not have it available the entire time. Also, it takes forever to get on the phone with anyone on support.

I don't recommend any of these delivery apps. I recently switched from Door Dash to Uber Eats. I made an order, and when the driver arrived, they mentioned that the items I ordered were missing and that the order needed to be canceled. Canceling the order on my phone ended up charging me $28. I contacted support, and they basically said theres nothing they can do because I canceled the order.

This app is not worth paying for. The restaurants screw up often and miss parts of your order, which then support refuses to refund, so the 'membership discount' is basically the cost of your food you're not getting. Support is useless and won't give you any real answers, just says 'no' and that's it. I have not had a SINGLE correct order in the past two weeks. Download literally any other food delivery app, customer service is the absolute worst and you'll never actually get what you order.

Everytime I think my experience is a fluke, the next experience is worse. I've had countless items missing (or possibly stolen) from orders including a whole pizza on a 3 item order once. My latest order arrived 2 hours after placed and that was after the previous attempt at ordering had to be canceled because the restaurant closed and never made the order. Support has completely been replaced by automated responses and is useless in helping out anything other than canceling an order.

Horrible customer service and poor app UI. Restaurant and grocery orders very often are missing items, or food is damaged like eggs being completely cracked. Uber has never once offered any sort of refund or voucher. How can you charge me when entire items are missing from the order? It's also now very hard to get a human representative, and all they tell me to do is leave a review on the order. DoorDash is better in every way. They give refunds right away after sending photo proof.

The estimated time to receive food is always off by at least 15 minutes. My arrival times are constantly pushed back. There have been too many errors with my orders and Uber hasn't refunded me, just gave me a small credit that doesn't even pay for the ridiculous and unnecessary fees they charge. Will be deleting this and downloading door dash.

I've done a few orders, and the experience has been pretty awful. One of my orders had a completely wrong item and it said it refunded me for it, but I got half of what I was supposed to get. I also made a four piece grocery order to try it of which two of the items I ordered said "many available", but they were marked as out of stock. Everything is at least 20% more expensive through this app than ordering through the store. Promos don't easily show up. UI can be confusing. Terrible experience.

I paid extra so my driver would have no other orders, yet over an hour and a half later, nothing has even been picked up. I donâ€™t mind paying for convenience, but I expect speed, efficiency, and honesty. Every time I use this app, drivers stall or go off-route. DoorDash isnâ€™t perfect, but itâ€™s more reliable than this. Donâ€™t waste your money paying a premium for worse service.

This app is 50/50 on weather you'll get your food. Three times now I've ordered and the estimated wait time just kept increasing. Three times I waited and ended up not eating that day becuase I thought this app was going to be reliable and did go get my own food. By the time it says I'm not getting food, it's too latr for me to go get my own. Update: I tried to get a hold of someone and it was a huge struggle. Update 2: now you can't adjust tip. So, if they throw your food and ruin it, too bad.

I realized i had put in the wrong address and within seconds I canceled the order and reordered with the correct address. However I got charged with an order cancelation saying they had "already started preparing the food." A bit hard to believe that my order was started within 5-10 seconds of placing it. And I normally would not have minded had the cancelation charge not been nearly the full price of the order itself. I tried contacting customer support but they were no help. Felt scammed.

The support offered by this service is below expectations. It is more difficult to get in touch with a real person than it should be. They will make you wait 30min to connect with someone. That person will then not be able to help you outside of the bare minimum. I recommend you use another app like DoorDash, or better yet simply order from the restaurant. Both options are often cheaper, the latter tends to pay the restaurant better, and are more considerate of the customer's time.

After I ordered a meal from Fiorella's Jack Stack,the app said I had a few minutes ( timing down as I searched) to order something else from another store w/o the delivery fee. I got an icecream,& went to check out. They added the delivery fee anyway. Then the app had said I would get as 15,% off of a $30 order. Nope. In small print on thee next page it says on your next order. This has got me before. I am getting real tired of the games, etc.

I had an issue with an item I ordered, it took two days to hear back from them, and that was because I started a separate chat after they refused to reply to my first chat. I had placed an order for tortillas, which would cost $3-4 in store, but somehow cost $22 through UberEats. ðŸ‘Ž This company will overinflate the prices of items they sell, straight up mislabel the item being sold to reflect a different quantity for the price, and will not assist you if you are asking for compensation.

App is laggy, multiple different kinds of promotions are glitchy, grocery shoppers are lazy and will select item not available for 10 items within a 2 minute time span, when they do replace an item the app will often overcharge you for it (my total for my last order was 20$ higher than it should be because I was charged 35$ for potatoes), support is illiterate and takes multiple days to respond and when they do they'll just repeat what the previous agent said. overpriced, scummy & awful business

took me a half hour to get everything setup for the first time. had to add my license take a selfie. when I ordered they said I could use a $15 off coupon. when I was checking out they said it wouldn't be applied even though I did everything to qualify. probably not going to use this app ever again now I spent my gift card someone bought me. too much trouble!

Absolutely horrible! Items were in my cart as i was looking to place n order, their app had spme weird glitch and froze then my screen changed saying it placed the order. First instinct was to cancel the order as i had not confirmed the order . Then they claimed the order was accepted and i would still be charged because its my fault. HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. i would have done right and said i understand, i can process a one time refund but thats it. Stealing money from people.

edit: they took extra money after I saw the receipt, around 2.5$(this is what I discovered!!) I will give them this one star because of the following:- 1-I ordered one order with an offer but the offer got canceled and I paid everything, then I tried my best to reach the customer service and it is really hard to reach them. 2-I tried more than 7 times to apply a promo but it did not go through,en tried to reach out to the customer service but I could not, I do not know why it is this hard.

This app was good but now I dont even want to use them as a way to get food to me. I have had multiple fails where the guy didnt get anything on my list and instead made me spend money on something that wasn't on my list. when I went to that store they had everything that I requested on the Uber grocery list. Then I was ordering pizza hut at around 8 is and the drivers kept arriving at the restaurant and then not taking my order and they kept changing out for no reason so I didnt get my order.

This app used to be great. I got great deals on stuff I liked. Then the delivery fees went up. Today it was a delivery fee alone of $17 for three different places that I usually like to get. Then, if stuff is missing or wrong with my order, they won't give me a refund or credit. They're pretty much like "Aww. That sucks! Sorry, can't do anything but we'll use your feedback!" Uber One is a scam and until they fix these things, I refuse to use Uber Eats. I'd put my money towards Doordash.

UE is a scam... you cant file a complaint inside the app unless it relates to a specific order. the fact that you allow drivers to deliver multiple orders completely out of the way of the original order is out of control. THEN you want me pay an additional $5 to bump my order after already paying $3+ on every single item, plus services fee... that's 3 separate fees on top of your already upcharged policy. My current order has taken over an hour. I'm canceling my membership. Greedy fks!

Tonight was the last straw. I never received my order. Turns out it was 100% UberEATS fault. After waiting 3 hours, being told it was delayed over and over & if I cancelled I would be charged plus a cancellation fee. Finally, they say the order would have to be cancelled and if I still wanted it I would have to get it myself. I am disabled and now don't have access to food since dinner is over. They say not their problem at least they won't charge for the food that I didn't get, so generous.

Compare prices to in person shopping. You're going to see additional cost when ordering through the app. The way I see it, they are pretty good at hiding how they're going to gouge you out, uber one isn't some incredible benefit theyre just getting their money out of you another way so keep that in mind.

I ordered food through Instacart which has Uber eats in their app. I was ordering a salad, they prompted me to spend more to avoid delivery fees ($8!!), so I did they still charged me the delivery fee, plus a service fee, it was nearly $15 for fees. I complained and they said that there's nothing they could do. Doordash they are not. never again

Customer service has gone downhill. Used to be great. Now when there's an order issue it can take forever to chat with someone, and they are super stingy with refunds. I waited an hour for an order that was never delivered and was offered $10 in compensation (on a $50 order). Got the wrong item another time and was given a $5 credit. Not good enough. They now also bait and switch with promos - they unapplied it and won't refund me.

This is currently extremely hard to use. I rely on the favorite list a lot because I keep going to the same restaurants again and again. Now the favorite list cannot be opened for more than two days. And that was why I was not using another App because its favorite list was hard to use. The next option is to just search, and Uber Eats forces the video browsing on the user. I don't want to see videos, I just need list of restaurants and what they have. You're not a social media app. Just Stop.

Issue with discount coupons. Applied code at checkout, it's accepted, but disappeared during payment process. CS will not do anything to assist. Delivery drivers are great. We've been traveling and had food delivered in multiple states, drivers are always fantastic. Lots of options, can choose type of food, i.e. Thai, Mexican, etc. to narrow restaurant search. Offer grocery delivery as well. Fees are steep imho.

No customer service available. If you need help you'll be choosing from a list of pre-written responses. None of which are "talk to an actual person". It's like pulling teeth whenever there is an issue, the experience is beyond frustrating. We are already paying well over menu price and then the vague nondescriptive fees that get added on and then "reduced".

Uber eats always gives me an initial delivery estimate, then changes it multiple times. It automatically changes the estimate so you won't see the original time they gave you. The restaurants shown on the home page won't necessarily be the closest location to me (when a chain has multiple locations in the city). They also have much higher fees. The default tips are much higher than other apps (based on a percentage of the order, rather than a flat fee for distance).

I wish is could give this app -10 stars. The glitches are never ending - the app updates are weekly, the cart doesn't load half the time, pages freeze, and now there's a page size issue (the bottom part of the app isn't even available anymore - you can't access the 0 when trying to add a tip, or the menu buttons). This app is a nightmare. And this service has gone downhill drastically over the years. The fees are outrageous. Very disappointing.

I am using this app on the chromebook, and clicking anything is very likely to accidently take you to a different store than whatever you were trying to actually click on to look at. this is understandable, a simple bug, and how many beings are trying to use this app on a chromebook other than me anyways. on all the phones I have ever owned this on, it has been perfect, but my Chromebook? no, needs work.

I continually get wrong items or wrong variants that I can't eat from different stores and Uber has no real person customer support. It is literally just an AI bot that says oh well that sucks and keeps your money. I will be switching to door dash. I found out items were cheaper there without premium anyway. They also refuse to refund after a driver cancels while you've been waiting for an hour. They tell you you need to be waiting at least 2 hours for them to cancel.

Worst experience I've ever had with an app. Still not sure if it was a scam. I went online to order, and there was a $20 promo. I used the promo, but it wouldn't add. A pop up came up to install the app, which I did. The promo added, only to be taken off at the end for an unspecified reason. The taxes also went up on the same exact order. When I tried to cancel, it was nearly impressive. I went to leave a review, and it showed that I needed to download the app. I'd already downloaded it.

Time to close my account and delete the app. I placed 3 orders this week and with my luck every single one was messed up. First 2 I got refunded, 3rd one Ãœber denied. From searching online, if you have too many refunds Ãœber doesn't care if your order is messed up. what a joke of a customer service for the amount of service fee its charging.

Trash app. it's better to shut down the service if it is delivered so disgustingly. I'm satisfied that I have cancelled my Uber one membership. never ever subscribing again. The orders take almost an hour and a half to get it delivered. Never on time. Moreover when the food is delivered it's cold and soggy. Also found missing items several times. The customer service is literally unhelpful. all they do is credit 20% of the total amount. They cancel orders after making you wait for an hour.

title: Pixel Camera
description: Never miss a moment with Pixel Camera! Take fantastic photos and videos using features like Portrait, Night Sight, Time Lapse, and Cinematic Blur. Take stunning photos â€¢ HDR+ with Exposure and White Balance Controls - Take incredible photos using HDR+, especially in low-light or backlit scenes. â€¢ Night Sight - Youâ€™ll never want to use your flash again. Night Sight brings out all the details and colors that get lost in the dark. You can even take photos of the Milky Way with Astrophotography! â€¢ Camera Coach - Get suggestions and guidance with the help of Gemini models to take better photos â€¢ Auto Best Take - With a single shutter button press, never miss the moment of all your friends â€¢ Super Res Zoom - Get way close from far away. Super Res Zoom makes your pictures sharper when you zoom in. â€¢ Pro Res Zoom - Zoom up to 100x, powered by an advanced generative imaging model â€¢ Add Me - Get the whole group in your pics, even the person taking the photograph â€¢ Long Exposure - Add a creative blur to moving subjects in the scene â€¢ Action Pan - Add a creative blur to the background while keeping your subject in focus â€¢ Macro Focus - Vivid color and striking contrast in even the smallest subjects â€¢ Pro Controls - Unlock advanced camera settings like shutter speed, ISO, and more Incredible videos on every take â€¢ Video Boost - Get ultra sharp video through AI processing in the cloud â€¢ Night Sight Video - Relive that perfect moment, even after dark â€¢ Record fluid high fidelity videos in stunning resolution with crisp audio, even in crowded places â€¢ Cinematic Blur - Create a cinematic effect by blurring the background behind your subject â€¢ Cinematic Pan - Slow down your phoneâ€™s panning movements â€¢ Long Shot - Take casual, quick videos by simply long-pressing the shutter key while in the default photo mode Requirements - The latest version of Pixel Camera only works on Pixel devices running Android 16 and above. The latest version of Pixel Camera for Wear OS only works on Wear OS 5.1 (and above) devices connected to Pixel phones. Some features are not available on all devices.
descriptionHTML:
Never miss a moment with Pixel Camera! Take fantastic photos and videos using features like Portrait, Night Sight, Time Lapse, and Cinematic Blur.

Take stunning photos
â€¢ HDR+ with Exposure and White Balance Controls - Take incredible photos using HDR+, especially in low-light or backlit scenes.
â€¢ Night Sight - Youâ€™ll never want to use your flash again. Night Sight brings out all the details and colors that get lost in the dark. You can even take photos of the Milky Way with Astrophotography!
â€¢ Camera Coach - Get suggestions and guidance with the help of Gemini models to take better photos
â€¢ Auto Best Take - With a single shutter button press, never miss the moment of all your friends
â€¢ Super Res Zoom - Get way close from far away. Super Res Zoom makes your pictures sharper when you zoom in.
â€¢ Pro Res Zoom - Zoom up to 100x, powered by an advanced generative imaging model
â€¢ Add Me - Get the whole group in your pics, even the person taking the photograph
â€¢ Long Exposure - Add a creative blur to moving subjects in the scene
â€¢ Action Pan - Add a creative blur to the background while keeping your subject in focus
â€¢ Macro Focus - Vivid color and striking contrast in even the smallest subjects
â€¢ Pro Controls - Unlock advanced camera settings like shutter speed, ISO, and more

Incredible videos on every take
â€¢ Video Boost - Get ultra sharp video through AI processing in the cloud
â€¢ Night Sight Video - Relive that perfect moment, even after dark
â€¢ Record fluid high fidelity videos in stunning resolution with crisp audio, even in crowded places
â€¢ Cinematic Blur - Create a cinematic effect by blurring the background behind your subject
â€¢ Cinematic Pan - Slow down your phoneâ€™s panning movements
â€¢ Long Shot - Take casual, quick videos by simply long-pressing the shutter key while in the default photo mode

Requirements - The latest version of Pixel Camera only works on Pixel devices running Android 16 and above. The latest version of Pixel Camera for Wear OS only works on Wear OS 5.1 (and above) devices connected to Pixel phones. Some features are not available on all devices.
summary: Camera app for Pixel

scraped_reviews.content: The basic interface for photo editing has not changed for many years. However, a recent update totally revamped it, making it much less user friendly in my opinion. But much worse than that, now every few times that I am editing a photo, after a couple of minutes of editing, it just bombs out of the editing section without saving my progress! And yes, I'm sure that everything is up to date. Very frustrating to say the least... Also, this 500 character limit causes me to have violent thoughts...

Great camera app. I especially love the astrophotgraphy features. The picture quality is always excellent with my pixel 8 pro. I also like how I can control everything from shutter speed to iso levels, exposure, manual lense selection, and many of the same features as high end digital cameras. I really don't get the complaints. My phone takes great photos with this app. My only complaint is that they need to compensate for the rotation of the Earth in astrophotgraphy.

Darkens all my photos automatically. Not the brightness, but makes the darker colors of the photo even darker and ups the contrast. I've messed with every setting and looked for solutions online and have had no success. It's so freaking annoying. You don't realize how important color truth is until you don't have it. My black cat recently died and I didn't get any good photos of him because of this issue for the last couple years of his life.

I often take product photos and had been using a Samsung s21 ultra where I was able to save different profiles on their pro camera app. However, the pixel will not allow you to save settings to different profiles so I have to change all the settings every time I'm taking photos. The pixel camera is amazing, don't get me wrong, but the camera app is just not great for people who are going to do more than just point and click.

I don't know what happened, but when I take landscape photos now, the photos are not roasted accordingly in photos, I have to manually edit and rotate them to do this individually now. this stinks because for videos, I just don't see a way to rotate at all when this just used to happen aromatically with zero editing required. yes auto rotate is on. it just displays all photos and videos as if they were taken in portrait (vertical) mode, which is by far my least used orientation.

Keystone or deskew, whatever you want to call it--it just worked, and it was a great feature in the crop toolbox. But now we have "autoframe" that does nothing like the same thing, and for months, Google has been claiming that they'd restore the lost feature. Stop lying. If the feature is permanently deprecated, stop stringing along your customers. I'm ready to go back to a DSLR, desktop photo editing, and a flip phone at this point.

I don't know if it's the camera that's gotten worse, or the photo editors, but whenever I try to use portrait mode, it's not able to focus on the subjects. if there's any slight difference between foreground and background placing. placing. it used to autocorrect and include all of the subjects, while still blurring the background. both of these apps have really gone downhill since their last few updates.

I mean, it works but the quality and overall experience of trying to take a picture is AWFUL. My 4a5G camera experience was 10x better and that's sad. I upgraded to the 9a, and so far all the apps have been downgraded and weighed down by pointless features that either don't work or straight up break the original function of the app. I took a photo of something, and the camera kept trying to "correct" the color out of the object! Couldn't even turn it off as there was no setting affected it.

Basic functionality is not enough in this era of smartphones. Gestures used to trigger the shutter work 20% with good contrast between the hand and what's behind it, worse for darker skin; any movement immediately disengages the trigger as well. Not having a voice activation at this point, 10+ years after Samsung pretty much perfected it, is not only disappointing, but shameful. Light compensation is.. fine. post processing is okay. Lack of true shot/shutter settings is laughable for 'pro' mode

Update: Five years on and the camera and app haven't quite kept pace with others in the industry. While there is more manual control, appreciated, there is also more AI "enhancement" that can't be disabled, not appreciated. Excellent all around camera app. Great integrated AI for portraits, HDR+ for beautiful I agree, and quick response for action shots.

My 3a takes WAY BETTER photos. Had high hopes the 8 Pro would be an upgrade but nope. The night mode totally sucks its night vision now useless. Getting astro mode to engage is difficult pictures aren't nearly as crisp or bright as my pixel 3a. It still takes awesome pictures. Pro features are not anything I couldn't do with my 3a .zoom defaults to part way zoomed in so I always have to zoom out and now it's opposite slide. Going see if I can find another 3a .

it's fine, it's a camera. but developers please add a way I can see which way the camera is oriented. so many times I take a picture and it's upside down or sideways. There is no indication until I take the picture, it's frustrating and I don't want to edit or retake every photo. It's a simple thing I have seen in most other camera apps.

used to be an okay camera app. very fisheyed but I've chalked that up to my phone's physical camera. having the "erase" feature was amazing, had a little spot of something that ruins an otherwise perfect picture? have someone you don't know/like in the background? used to be no issue to select and remove but now it's almost impossible, AI jumps in and warps the whole image so much that the whole "erase" feature is basically useless. way to ruin the best part of the app.

Ever since the update to my camera, it doesn't work correctly. I can't hardly use my camera, because if I try to zoom in at ALL, even a little tiny bit, one of two things happens. 1. It freezes the screen and I can't zoom in or out, so I have to force stop the app. 2. It completely crashes. Needless to say, I HATE the new app and I wish I could roll it back to when it was not only perfect, but also WORKED. One of the main reasons I bought the upgrade to my Pixel 7 Pro, was for the camera.

I have mixed feelings about this app. I love it most of the time. I get super crisp/sharp photos, the colors are vibrant, the zoom is amazing....but....lately, it won't focus in on my subject. I have missed a lot of great nature shots because the lens wants to focus on something close to the subject or the background. It is incredibly frustrating and annoying. Also, every edit makes you save it as a copy.

Not sure what happened with recent update, but the camera loses focus very quickly now and doesn't do well getting back into focus. I think this could be related to problems with the HDR too because a few of my recent photos have a super bright, yet out-of-focus background, while the item I was focused on in the foreground was made very dark. The basic editing options in Google Photos wasn't able to overcome this, so I'll need to fix it in different software.

As I found out the hard way a few times, this app needs a record button lock feature especially in bright sunlight. It is difficult at times to see the red record button and whether it's actually lit or not. Then if you accidentally tap it without knowing it, the video camera may not actually be on when you think it is, or it's on when you think it isn't. I have lost out on some choice footage because there's no way to lock it.

This new update is awful! I can't edit a photo more than once without being forced to save it as a copy. The crop handles are much more difficult to grab and there's a big lag in moving them. The so-called AI features only give me a circling icon and don't produce a result even after a full minute. I'm looking for a better camera app!

Why did you remove the keystone edit feature in your latest release??? Here is why I use that feature ALL OF THE TIME: you are in an art museum. the picture is above your head or the only way to avoid reflections is at an angle. I use the keystone edit feature to straighten the picture to look as if I am standing in front of the picture. And all of those AI features are worthless to me.

Scanning documents is a big problem, it doesn't work right! Sometimes the message to scan will pop up, but then quickly disappears, I never seem to press the option soon enough and so I can't scan. Very disappointing and frustrating. Also I do not see an option otherwise where I can choose to ask it to scan.

I was just in a hit and run and could not use my camera to take a photo of the vehicle and plate. I'm tired of it freezing up and not opening. When I try to use the zoom, it freezes my camera. It randomly stops working. Complete fail on your part Google! I do all the updates and restart my phone. Nothing fixes it! Now I have no proof of who hit me.

How could a phone known for its camera not have a manual focus mode? You can lock the focus, but there's no manual adjustments anymore? It's absurd that to continuously tapping the screen in hopes that the app decides to focus on the right thing. Trying to snap a pic through a rainy window or something small or far away? You will miss the shot. What a failure from one of the largest companies in the history of the world. Thanks for the garbage experience, idiots.

The updates are horrid. Absolutely horrid. Like I said in August I hate the new features since updating. You cannot erase anything. Just trying is more steps than has ever been. Then after trying to erase, the photo goes silver then eventually the whole picture is gray and then the old photo pops back with no erasing. Even after saving. Cropping is STILL a joke. So much easier before the update. As soon as I can afford a new phone I'm trashing my phone and no more Google pixel phones. zero stars

Having a lot of the same issues with this software over and over again. I was really excited to take my pixel 8 to the ocean and come to find out I can't get the application to work which sucks because I've already missed a bunch of great shots. It's like the camera lags out and then freezes up with a bunch of black lines and dots. I can't even get it to close the shutter anymore. Please fix this issue. Have uninstalled and reinstalled several times. I think it's the over bloated AI

this is my third Pixel and definitely the last. I take pictures daily for work and it's been the same with each one. in general the phone gets hot easy so it won't zoom or let flash work. The camera is unresponsive 1 out of every 4 times and I have to go out and come back in. Photos are blurry very easily. All 3 phones did this. I clear the cache and reboot and it's still the same. I can't be the only one with this problem. The menu screen is hard to flip away and always comes on. Fix please !

scanning PDFs completely breaks at the end if you are using Firefox instead of Chrome as your default browser. After taking a very long time to scan in 50 pages, I hit the save button only for the app to open up a broken URL in Firefox which did not download the PDF, and when I switched back to the camera app it was completely gone. It's clear that Google has prioritized integration with their own platforms like Google drive and Chrome instead of testing their apps like an actual user.

If the flash is on, there is an unremovable delay between pushing the button and capturing the photo. Not everyone is a useless social media influencer. Sometimes a person just needs to take a photo of a pipe in a dark place. A million useless "features" I'll never use, but you can't just include a simple point and shoot with flash option.

The newest update takes away all of the editing tools from the Top Shot mode, which was the only redeemable feature of this limited app. PUT THEM BACK!! I don't know what they did to Portrait Blur but that doesn't work anymore either. Also, the fact that you can't "lock-in" an exposure while taking video makes it basically worthless, especially in low-light environments. Even if you set it by finding your subject, the auto-exposure keeps overriding you resulting in overexposure.

One thing that is important to me as a professional geologist is the location data of my photos (I use that in my work). The location button has been turned on all the time lately in the app but no location data is provided. so there is a big problem with this software that needs fixing. Even with the help of AI it looks like there is no way to fix this on my end. This problem has cost me time, loss of money, and future work.

listen, pixel, we have some work to do. one thing that annoys me the most is that whenever i attempt to take a picture of something or myself, my camera automatically inverts, so my pictures come out inverted, and i cant find a way to turn it off. also, the "magic eraser" literally erases everything, like even the backround. it doesnt even blend out, it just leaves a bunch of sploches and a whole mess i cant work with. id much rather not invert my camera when taking pictures, thank you!

The quality is terrible. It doesn't stay focused no matter what settings I try. even in videos. there are no in camera filters that you can apply. you can't adjust the brightness. the flash button is not readily visible. I bought this phone over a Samsung Galaxy because the camera seemed better. It is complete garbage. Not to mention you need to have backup on to search for types of photos in your gallery. I just updated it a couple weeks ago and now it's a pain to share/crop photos, too. ðŸ‘ŽðŸ‘ŽðŸ‘Ž

Please! Get rid of AI. I want the old photo editing software. I want to be able to crop and pick the corners on a doc. I want the old adjust button back, black point, white point, contrast, HDR. I try to enlarge a picture with my fingers I get markups on it, have to find where the markup is, go backwards to erase, them too much junk too little real adjustment buttons. I'm a professional photographer sometimes all I have is my phone but I sure would like better editing like my Pixel 4a 5g had.

(Pixel 8) Never seems to capture the subtle colors or movements I see, because it's busy trying to optimize the colors to meet some sort of coloring-book standard. Cloud pics are always adjusted to be too blue, no subtle purples or greys. UPDATE: The colors could still be better, but the picture stays steady when I'm trying to frame a shot, & they've added a levelling bar to help you see if you're holding the camera straight or not. Lens still distorts the pic a lot tho.

Ever since I've backed up some of my photos, I get a message to free up space to take more photos. I do sometimes run low on space; however, even after clearing my cache so there's enough, I still get the message. Further, if I manage to sneak pressing the camera button before that pesky alert appears, the camera does take the photo. So clearly I can take photos. I cannot find an option to turn that feature off and, until I do, 1 star for you.

It's like someone who has never used a camera made the pixel camera app. It's so clunky to switch on the flash, tap tiny icons, navigate multi-click menus, take a video (looks way better from camera mode but video sometimes doesnt fire), and you end up missing the moment. A good camera app (they do exist and I have used them!) boots up quickly and has the major controls at your fingertips for easy snapping. Absolutely inexcusable lapse in quality from this massive megacorp. You have no excuse.

I recently purchased the Pixel 8. Strangely, the camera is performing poorly, both with zooming and zooming out, and even in night mode when there's sufficient light in the environment, the camera is full of noise! And there's also bluish-purple halo visible. It's just not functioning well at all. I'm really disappointed-I didn't expect this at all..

Pixel 6 pro here. Everytime I take a photo of something in movement the processing breaks it. Before processing it looks ok, but after processing a lot of pink and green pixels, and phantom objects, appear where there was movement. It broke a lot of photos from my vacations. I uninstalled updates and it works good, so it's something they did. When it automatically updates, the error appears again. Additionally, the processing is applied to RAW PHOTOS. I'm specially upset about this.

Camera app will no longer zoom when viewing a photo. Only my last photo is viewable. The gallery button in the upper right corner is missing. Also I'm unable to swipe through photos. Pinch to zoom and double tap to zoom doesn't work. I decline the pushy, online backup suggestion, when opening the camera app. I don't want Google to have my personal photos & videos on their servers. Update: Taking another picture fixed the issues. Update 2: The issue came back. The fix is now a workaround. ðŸ«¤

I heard a lot of great things about Google's camera and camera app so I decided to switch to a Pixel Pro, and I am severely disappointed. Every image I take is drab compared to what I'm actually seeing. The AI processing will randomly blowout certain colors like reds and make others almost grayscale (like greens or blues). The RAW images don't look much better so there's not even a good base to tweak things myself. I compared to my 3 year old previous phone, and the differences are astounding.

Flat out doesn't work. I have a shiny new Pixel 8a. At first I made a couple of test shots and it seemed to work, but a few weeks later I tried again and saw that pictures taken in the Photo mode literally disappeared before my eyes, processed to solid black when saving. I reverted from 9.7 to 9.4 and that took pictures but added lines of mashed pixels down the whole left quarter of the picture, in any mode. Hence useless. I can only use the camera with third-party photo apps.

When I got my phone, this camera was awesome. No problems, used it often. These past couple months, it says "continue" or "close app" repeatedly. I can't switch from selfie to taking pics of something else. It worked once on safe mode and was fine for a while, but now it won't even work in safe mode. I uninstalled recent apps, no luck. Please, fix this. Will change review to more stars if camera starts working again..

Used to be great and easy to use. In the 'more' section of the camera I would open it to choose the size image I wanted. This was very handy when I want to post something directly to FB, I could make the image quite small. I cannot seem to do that now, now I have to take my image to Photoshop and jack with it. I am so annoyed! I got the pixel 3a xl specifically for the camera and it's wonderful features. Very disappointed with 'if it ain't broke, let's fix it and make it broke' ðŸ‘Ž

I don't like that it won't save pictures (particularly Selfies) as they were taken. Instead, I will pull up a picture after having taken it, and it will stop to process the image, and present me with a completely altered thing. With selfies, in particular, it won't stop darkening and shrinking my features. It's very annoying. What gives? I think I'll stick to a more realistic, reliable and professional camera app. So much for using the lauded pixel for photography ðŸ™„

Camera works great. It's taking awesome pictures of dog. My only problem is it doesn't have good one handed accessibility, that I can find at least. I don't expect 100% of features to be available with one hand, but at least zoom should be easier to access. I always preferred zoom buttons over pinch, but now that I broke my arm I'm even more appreciative of buttons. Also, it sucks that it requires Google photos to see the pictures I took. it should just open whatever my default gallery app is.

This camera sucks. Plain and simple. Recently the app just decided to stop working all together. I have tried to uninstall and reinstall the app, but it doesn't allow me to. As far as the graphics: If I take a regular picture it looks grainy. Zooming in makes it look like the picture was taken a couple of decades ago. The best I can do (when the app works) is set it to Portrait. And even then, it's not that much better.

The digital zoom stabilization feature tries to keep your camera framed on the same subject even if your aim drifts or shakes. However, for several months or more, it has been recording an image different from the one shown on the screen (likely it is cropping the wrong area of the image). This effectively ruins any video I take with zoom. Considering I bought the Pixel in part for the amazing camera, it puts a pretty big damper in that experience. Hope it's fixed soon ðŸ¤ž

Like everyone else, I'm dealing with the issue of something in either the firmware or software not allowing me to use my rear cameras. I'm using a P4XL, and like others, the frustration is there. I think the worst part of it all is I don't know when it started. Edit 6/18/20: After about of month of working or so, it started crashing again. Unfortunately, as much as I may love Google phones, I won't stay with a company that can't iron out issues that have been going on for half a year.

My pixel 2 xl back camera stopped working this afternoon, I tried all software "solutions" except factory reset, nothing worked. So I saw a post with putting a magnet on top of the camera, tried it, didn't work. Then I tried to move the magnet around the camera while turning on the camera app, and there's a sweet spot and the camera is working again. The spot for my camera is under the spot between the camera and the flash. Let see how long this will last, seems like it's a hardware issue?

Same issue as everyone else. Rear camera doesn't work, just shows a black screen before crashing and leaving the app. Selfie cam works, but that's it. Very frustrating. I have had my Pixel 2XL for under a year and thousands of us should NOT be dealing with this issue. This has been happening with my phone for almost two weeks now. Google, step up and fix this NOW.

Was a great app until end of June my cameras both quit working and after going through troubleshooting with Google my phone is 6 months out of warranty and it's a device issue. Seriously how can it be a device issue if everyone starting having the same issue at the same time. I wasn't born yesterday lol. I used to rant and my phone and now I can't wait to switch. Pretty sad they can't figure out what they did wrong and just correct it.

title: Great Learning: Online Courses
description:
The Great Learning app enables professionals & new graduates to learn in-demand skills and help them achieve career success. 

What do you get from the app - 

Get complete access to full-time postgraduate, Masters and Degree programs for working professionals as well as short, free courses to get started with. The courses are focused on building skills in the field of - 

* Data Science
* Machine Learning
* Artificial Intelligence
* Cloud Computing
* CyberSecurity
* Marketing and Finance
* Big Data
â€¦ and many more 

The Best app to learn industry-relevant skills:

Upskill with the best-in-class postgraduate, Masters & certificate programs in new-age skills to make you job-ready.If you are a new graduate, learn from beginner-friendly modules designed by leading industry practitioners and academicians in association with the worldâ€™s most renowned universities.


Start learning for free with Great Learning Academy 

Get started for free with Great Learning Academy: Free online courses to enable you to prepare for the corporate world. The free courses cover challenging topics in an easy-to-understand manner. Once you complete the course, get a certificate to share on your professional network and get noticed by recruiters.


Learn from the worldâ€™s best 

Choose from world-class universities 
Learn AI, Data Science, Business Analytics and other industry-focused fields,  from globally renowned universities like MIT-IDSS, Great Lakes, University of Texas McCombs and more. 

Gain valuable industry insights
LIVE interactions with industry experts that help you build context for the skills you learn. Youâ€™ll learn from professionals with many years of experience and strong skills in the top domains.

Showcase your expertise
Once you successfully complete a course, you will get a certificate which you can share on your social and professional network. These certificates will help you stand out to recruiters and add value to your professional profile.

Achieve career success
Get career guidance, interview prep  and mentorship from experts and find the best opportunities to help you build the career of your dreams.

Learn anywhere, anytime 
Our programs are designed for busy professionals. Learn at your convenience with pre-recorded lectures and videos anytime, anywhere.

Always keep your skills up to date
With continuously updated course content aligned to industry demands, youâ€™ll master the latest tech and business skills, staying ahead in your field.

Get 24*7 program support 
Our team of professional program advisors will guide you every step of the way throughout the program, until you graduate 

Study Abroad (USA| Germany)` 
Grab the chance to learn abroad at low, feasible costs.


About Great Learning

Great Learning is Indiaâ€™s leading professional learning platform, with a mission to make professionals proficient and future-ready. Its programs always focus on the next frontier of growth in industry and currently straddle across Analytics, Data Science, Big Data, Machine Learning, Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, Cloud Computing, and more. Great Learning uses technology, high-quality content, and industry collaboration to deliver an immersive learning experience that helps candidates learn, apply, and demonstrate their competencies. All programs are offered in collaboration with leading global universities and are taken by thousands of professionals every year to secure and grow their careers.

summary: Learn Data Science, Marketing, AI ML, Cloud Computing & More With 1000+ Courses.

scraped_reviews.content: I have enrolled in one of the courses with great learning. The app does not work, it just shows the splash screen and is stuck there for days. It makes it difficult to access content, have to always login to olympus from the laptop.

I have completed the Introduction to Cybersecurity course, but after completing the quiz at the end, they ask me to pay 349 for the certificate. They don't give any information about paying for the certificate in the whole course or In the information detail brochure. This is very bad. So please keep in mind before pursuing any online course in this app that when you complete the free course, they will charge for the certificate
the video reloads a bit randomly sometimes but its not a big deal. W app/website for making it easier for people to learn while also provide free courses. big W fr fr

worst app ever for any course first they will show you that course is free but after completing the course they will ask you to pay for the certificate. this platform doesn't even deserve 1 star rating

I enrolled in a few online courses offered by Great Learning based on their advertisement that certificates would be provided for free upon completion. However, after completing the courses, I was surprised to find that they were asking for payment to issue the certificateâ€”contrary to what was initially promised. I attempted to reach out to their support team via email for clarification and assistance regarding the certificate. Unfortunately, I did not receive any response, which is disappointi

This app is the most ridiculous app i have ever seen when it comes to performance. Even after the download of videos if u lost connection it will still stop working. u can never get on screen options at once, for example to even pause a video i tap 100 times on the screen, or if u want to rewind u again tap for at least 10 times. PS: its not a problem with my phone because none of the other apps lag. i installed in other new phone its the same performance. Get a developer and fix this app
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Dear Ananya, we're sorry for the inconvenience caused by the app's performance. Our team is actively working to improve the app. Please reach out to us at academy@greatlearning.in with more details so our team can look into it and resolve the issue as soon as possible.

scraped_reviews.content: This has been one of the most disappointing learning apps and online training institutes I've encountered in the past three months. The app is riddled with issues related to assessments, certificates, referrals, and the "gift a course" feature. As for the online courses, they feel less like a true edtech offering and more like a marketing-driven operation. Instead of investing in quality trainers, the company seems to prioritize hiring call center employees who create more hassle for learners.

This new update is completely ridiculous. First of all there is a major bug issue, it continuously glitched and after all the efforts I gave to complete the course and the quiz even with complete marks then they ask for 199 for the certificate which they used to provide for free after completion few years ago. I'm completely pissed over this new update, and wished if it could be like the previous one again.

I found the "Great Learning" application to be learner friendly and career ðŸ‘¨â€ðŸ’¼ skill enhancing, the Learning content is also one of the best internationally ðŸŒ in the Education Sector from India ðŸ‡®ðŸ‡³...

âš ï¸ Worst learning platform ever. I wasted hours completing a course, watched every video, passed the quiz ... and still didnâ€™t get credit. Then they ask for money for the certificate they said was free. The app is buggy, slow, and a total scam. Donâ€™t install. Donâ€™t trust. Just avoid.
the best app I already have has two global recognized qualifications for machine learning and I'll add by learning advanced this is the best app completely for free and I'm in college
It works but it consumes more than 5 minutes to open, can't wait but irritate, no matter what strong network, WiFi we have, WHY? please update the fast opening time on android phone.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi learner, we are sorry for the inconvenience. To help you with this, we would like to know your feedback in detail so please write to us at academy@greatlearning.in. We will help you at the earliest.

scraped_reviews.content: worst app.it takes so much time to open,and continue the whole process.. i updated the app even open it in other phones..but still problem is same.. another thing is it mentioned courses are free but for certificate they show some charges of amount right now.
They will not let you delete your account. You are stuck with it. And every time you log in, it requires a verification code from your email, and there's no option to turn that feature off.
app hangs and won't open most of the time. reinstall worked for a couple of times then history repeats.. app is not opening again. This needs an immediate fix, as the app is unusable now.

Courses are well explained. Had a wonderful experience. One suggestions which I would like to give is to improve the app's response time. Sometimes the response time is a bit longer than usual. However I feel by integrating this minor improvement in the app's UI, the overall experience with Great Learning Academy would be great.
scraped_reviews.replyContent: Hi Souvagya, we're sorry for the inconvenience caused by the app's performance. Our team is actively working to improve the app speed. Please reach out to us at academy@greatlearning.in with more details so our team can look into it and help resolve the issue as soon as possible.

scraped_reviews.content: I just did the hrm course, and my course is stuck on 94% I have completed all the lectures, and quiz and viewed AWS advance learn on resources. title: YouTube Kids
description:
Inspire your kids to uncover their unique interests
Help your kids explore video content they love and parents trust, in an app made just for kids. With easy navigation tools and a suite of features, you can help your kids spend time online uncovering new interests, unleashing their imagination, and building their confidence in their own unique world.

Help your kids grow at their own pace
Your kids are unique, so they should only see content they're ready to explore. Decide what videos will help them make the most of their time online, then personalize individual profiles using custom content filters as they grow.

- Help your youngest kids learn their ABCs, nurture their curiosity, and more in the Preschool mode.
- Expand your kids interests to songs, cartoons, or DIY crafts in Younger mode.
- Give your older kids the freedom to search popular music and gaming videos in Older mode.
- Or hand-pick the videos, channels, and collections your kids can see in Approved Content Only mode.

Rewatch videos and bond over favorites
Quickly find your kidsâ€™ favorite videos and the content youâ€™ve shared with them in the Watch it Again tab.

Shape your kidsâ€™ viewing experience with Parental Controls
Parental Control features help you limit what your kids watch and better guide their viewing experience. Our blocking process aims to help keep videos on YouTube Kids family-friendly and safe â€“ but each family's preferences are unique. Don't like a video or channel, or see inappropriate content? Flag it for our team to review.

Set a screen-time limit
Encourage your kids to take a break in between exploring content. Use the Timer feature to freeze the app when screen time is up so your kids can apply their new skills to the real world.

See important information
- Parental setup is needed to ensure the best experience for your family.
- Kids may see commercial content from YouTube creators that are not paid ads.
- See The Privacy Notice for Google Accounts managed with Family Link for information on our privacy practices for signing in with a Google Account.
- If your kids use the app without signing in with their Google Account, the YouTube Kids Privacy Notice applies.

scraped_reviews.content: I have the app on both my phone and our smart TV. It is a great collection of kids videos for all ages. I do have a suggestions. For phone, it is simple to slide the bar back to the beginning, but I'd like to see a restart or start from beginning button for TV app. For phone, I'm able to subscribe to channels but not while on the TV app. For TV app, if the highlight could be another color or bolder, it would be easier to locate.

Decent, but needs some improvement. It's nice to have more control of what my child sees on YouTube. The parental controls are good. The video controls are lacking; rewind is a 10 second rewind, there is no option to start from the beginning. If you go back to watch a video that you had already watched halfway,you have to watch from the last watched part. The select highlight on the tv is white on pale blue, it is not easy to see.

Love this for my 4 and 8 year olds. Has settings for parental controls (time limits, video types, history, ect) and I can easily set a pass code and timer. Also, you sign in with your YouTube account, but nothing on there goes into your history. Great app. Would like for there to be a better way to block videos or categories of videos. And to show only certain videos. If you have kids ages 4 to 10 this app is perfect.

So easy to use! My 2 year old is able to work it by himself! I love how I am able to block certain shows and channels I don't want him watching and it shows only age appropriate videos! You can also view what they have been watching. I also live how there are very very few apps! A lot less than regular YouTube. Every ad that does pop up is completely age appropriate, usually toys or kids shows. We probably only get 1 ad every other day or so.

Non-intuitive interfaces, bouncing between URLs and the app. And gosh forbid, if you forget your password while you are already logged into the app. Good luck. Apparently I have to go between the app and the website to try to figure out how to reconnect things, including the television. And the parental controls are almost worthless. If your kids are smart enough to search they can get to whatever they want. Especially YouTubers that waste their lives away setting for examples.

Perfect app. Intuitive to use for little kids, and super easy to manage for parents. I was having so much trouble getting Amazon kids to work for my 2yr old for long car trips, then i found this. I just pin the app and he can easily navigate without getting stuck. I use the mode where I choose exactly what videos are available, add his favorite channels, e.g. super simple songs, and he's set without my worrying at all about what he might find.

Too simple, all I want to do is subscribe to a handfull of channels and let that be the YouTube they can watch. I'm trying to choose only educational channels and documentaries which doesn't seem at all possible. Ideally, I'd like it to look like YouTube normally, but it shows "kid" and educational content only. I feel like some of these suggested videos are cheap pacifiers, not enriching.

I agree with everyone else there needs be more filters so I can control what they watch. The new "Approved Content Only" is a joke. I spent an hour looking through and approving channels, but after my daughter watched it for a little while all but 3 videos disappeared. I think its because it will only show "recommended" videos based on what she was watching. It should just show all the videos the channel has instead of narrowing it done. Given all the inappropriate content I'm uninstalling.

Unable to enter my birth year on lock screen. When I press on the data entry points, no keypad appears, so I can't enter my birth year. Unable to activate app. Edit: it turns out that the data entry keypad is only visible in landscape mode. This is a terrible user interface, there is no clue that there is something off screen in portrait mode which is the way 90% of people will use it on their phone. Upgrading to two stars.

It's fine with it works but frequently it'll cause my kids to meltdown. Sometimes it'll reset and I'll have to set it up again. Other times it'll randomly delete all their downloaded videos. We often use this app in the car and when they don't have downloaded videos, they get upset because they can't watch anything in the car. And once (so far), the videos disappeared in the middle of a car ride, so my kid was enjoying videos and then suddenly there were no downloads. I wish they would fix this!

Frustrated. I never had an account until today. My little is 2, and haven't had any issues. New issue, even after update, I don't know how it started, but I made an account. Now I can't cast to our Chromecast. It started on her tablet. I signed into her account from my phone (to see if it was just the device's issue), but now I can't cast from my phone either! So frustrating. I was able to cast just fine pre-profile. No wifi issues.

Like that so far, it only shows appropriate videos for kids. Not user-friendly with swipe controls. Trying to exit app on my pixel 8 is a nightmare. I usually just end up scrubbing the timeline of the player or returning to the pick a video screen. Also, you can't download hand-picked videos. The app will download what it wants when It wants with no way to change it.

This app is bad, I had to waste almost 3 minutes of watching an ad on YouTube Kids and I couldn't skip the ad at all and my children also had this ad as well and I think that It's something wrong with the code in this app or something so can you fix this issue? 1 Star.

There should be a serch option just for the chosen songs and videos, so you can find something particular, but the moment you exclude the restofYouTube (which you must, because otherwise lots of stuff you didn't want ends up in the algorithm), you can't search for specific videos. This is a problem when a kid wants Baby Shark specifically, but I can't find it.

My 2 year old is always signing out mistakenly while trying to change from one video to another, and since then i noticed that when you sign back in, the whole videos are deleted which makes me upset, it shouldn't be so, and then again once there is a network connection the deleted videos starts to download on it's own and i am not liking that at all. Please fo something about this listed issues.

Very annoying for kids to navigate. I have search disabled, and approved a few channels. instead of just letting them click on channel profiles it throws a bunch of random videos on a page they have to endlessly scroll. I can't get to specific creators. for example if I approve baby panda, blippie, and level up: blippie may never show..it's just lost in a garbled mess of panda and level up. Nice that I can block unwanted content but otherwise horrible.

too much sexual content, lable as something else. I've had to block several channels and videos despite settings, and the algorithm still markets inappropriate content. It's just not good. constantly checking and monitoring content that shouldn't be available for younger viewers. Literally cartoon music masking fruit and vegetables with fake faces being murdered is not 4 years old appropriate, but these channels are labeled for kids. So much for settings.

If it's supposed to be a child friendly app, you should be able to lock the video (like the normal YT version) so that your child can't scroll onto something else. There is also a lot of rubbish on it, although it's classed as child friendly there's a lot of stuff I don't want my child viewing and there doesnt seem to be much parental control in place to help with this.

you really need tk pay extra attention when letting your kids watch through this app. Even with the filters added. A video about a fly leaving eggs under skin is not for a toddler (under 4 years old is what I selected) even when it looks handdrawn. fake peppa pig is there as well and paw patrol. in 5 mins of searching I saw too much that zi wouldn't want my child exposes to.

why does the app give brain rot content to my baby, most cartoons are filled with agenda, and when you report the content another one pops up, same thing as the prev content. this youtube kids is not kid friendly anymore if just recommends inappropriate visuals and audio. im thinking of downloading cartoon videos instead because this app is not safe for our kids.

Too much inappropriate content for the ages selected. Monitor what your kids watch. A lot of weird content makes kids stupid from watching it. Nothing educational and nothing that uses a proper vocabulary just a bunch of noises, grunts and sound effects. I can see the difference in my children ages 4 and 28 just based on what they watched as children. My 4 year old watches these YouTube shows and gets so angry when I take the phone or tablet from him

Using this on my smart TV.. For my nephew's and niece. Quite helpful. Has lots of good kids educational story's. But there's also inappropriate videos of cartoon, a cartoon but with ridiculous contents. To me it's a little bit hard to avoid those items... ðŸ˜…. Restriction wise by adult is quite useful to select appropriate videos or cartoons to watch. I wish the choices of videos, cartoon, documentary or shows for kids has varieties of subtitles like English, Malay and different other languages.

YouTube Kids is great for preschoolers. My 4yr LOVES this app. it only shows videos that are right for my son using filters to keep out all the bad stuff. I set a timer for how long hes on it otherwise he'll stay on it all day if he could. He can navigate his way around the App all by himself it has lots of shows and videos that are fun and educational. there are no comments sections or live chats so your kids can't talk to people they don't know. I Highly recommend ðŸ˜Š

Reporting a video for inappropriate content doesn't make any sense. It's not like the real YouTube, and it's supposed to be just for kids, not adults. But some videos don't have subscribe buttons, and sometimes when you watch them, it doesn't show the channel. Also, some videos don't even have a pause button, which is really confusing. Btw, this is my dad's account.

The updated versions are worst than the outdated to be honest. Before the updates, you could view the kids channels subscriptions (now you can't), you could review the blocked content and select if you wanted to unblock a specific one (now, the only option is unblock all) and I still believe their should be options as to what would you like for the algorithm to appear and what not. Like for example, we don't celebrate Halloween and there is no option to restrict those content from appearing.

Can't limit to curated list As a parent, I just want to be able to pick a set of videos and/or channels it's ok for my child to watch. This appears to be impossible. The Family Link management transition removes the pure-curation capability entirely in favor of an age range specification and a requirement to trust the one-size-fits-all algorithm. Even with legacy curation, I'm not allowed to add content I think is appropriate, like Veritasium and Mark Rober.

I really like YouTube kids and it's parental control features, though I do need to put in more time tweaking it. We started using it when our kid was 2, and they're almost 5 now. You really need to pay attention. I was surprised that watching people play games like Minecraft and Roblox was viewable on general preschool settings. I'll be switching to approved channels only in the setting instead of allowing them to discover things on their own.

they should add an option to search for specific video language, sometimes my child end up watching videos in Thai, and because of the algorithm then the more you watch the more you get. so took me some time pre selecting videos of the languages she speaks so the algorithm doesn't offer Thai videos anymore

No option to filter out keywords. It is against my beliefs to celebrate Halloween and yet each time my 2 year old taps on a video, countless other Halloween videos are recommended. No matter how many times I block videos. There is an option to approve videos by me, but that greatly limits what he can watch and he will get bored of the same videos over and over. So this is not the solution. Update: Now videos I previously blocked are popping back up. So can't even rely on the block feature!

I've actually been using youtube kids since I was 6 or 5 idk, and... I have no trouble at all! but I don't exactly recommend this for very young kids, (like 3 year olds) because there is some content that kids aren't supposed to see, like for example: YouTubers that say really bad words or brainrots and anomalies, soo don't give this to ur kid if she/he is REALLY young

I do kinda like it but a issue WHEN I TRY TO GO TO A CHANNEL IT DOESN'T SHOW UP and when I'm trying to find something on youtoube kids it's just gonna give that I don't want and BTW I'm a 9yo kid so ya even I get tired of it there some videos that doesn't have a pause button and when I see a video be like:LIKE AND SUBSCRIBE FOR PART TWO.even tho I don't see it and I'm forced to watch this app stupid app and if I could I would give it 0 STARS!

I still love this better than youtube! update: Can you stop focusing on educational and focus more on entertainment? I can't find trainfan1055. can you add it on there?

all 4 of my grandkids love this app. I watch myself some of these short movies. they are excellent and you can learn a lot. would be nice if it could be in Afrikaans as well

There are videos on there that show things that are provocative, massive amounts of innuendo, and a ridiculous amount of siphoning from ads to questionable sites. so please, make this app safer. it's more like YouTube training wheels then something you should give your kid.

Thank you YouTube kids, it's being great using it for my son. His listening skills are really improving. 100% recommended for children's learning with parents guidance.
